talks.synopsis: My beloved brethren and sisters, we have been inspired by this outstanding and meaningful message of our prophet, seer, and revelator. In addition, this beautiful singing of our young people has been enjoyed by all of us.

talks.author: Hugh W. Pinnock
talks.title: Now Is the Time
talks.synopsis: Brethren and sisters, we are living in a strange time. It has been called the space age or computer age. However, it seems to be the age of blaming everyone and everything for any unfavorable condition. We blame acquaintances, parents, the Church, spouses, teachers, neighbors, the area where we dwell, or even the weather for our problems.

talks.author: L. Tom Perry
talks.title: Proclaim My Gospel from Land to Land
talks.synopsis: From the book of First Peter, we receive this counsel:

talks.author: Howard W. Hunter
talks.title: The God That Doest Wonders
talks.synopsis: In our Northern Hemisphere, we are enjoying in this beautiful, bursting season of the year one of the great recurring miracles of nature—the regeneration and renewal of the earth that we call spring. There may be a few wintry days left, but the sun has begun its vernal return, the buds are appearing on the flowers and trees, and luxuriant greenery is sprouting to the surface.

talks.author: Wilford G. Edling
talks.title: The Church Audit Committee Report
talks.synopsis: For the purpose of evaluating the adequacy of controls over receipts and expenditures of the general funds of the Church and its controlled organizations, we have reviewed the system of budgeting, accounting, and auditing, and the related financial statements of the Church for the year ended December 31, 1988, and the manner in which funds are received and expenditures are controlled.

talks.author: Marvin J. Ashton
talks.title: On Being Worthy
talks.synopsis: Over the past number of weeks I have had some conversations that have made me ponder the meaning of the word As I recently talked to a young twenty-year-old man, I discussed his attitude about going on a mission. He said, “I wanted to go, but I am not worthy.”

talks.author: Ronald E. Poelman
talks.title: Adversity and the Divine Purpose of Mortality
talks.synopsis: “Happiness,” in the words of the Prophet Joseph Smith, “is the object and design of our existence; and will be the end thereof, if we pursue the path that leads to it.” ( 5:134.) Often that path includes affliction, trials, and suffering—physically, mentally, and even spiritually.

talks.author: Glenn L. Pace
talks.title: Follow the Prophet
talks.synopsis: One day as one of my sons bade me farewell prior to his leaving for high school, I noticed he had forgotten to tie his shoelaces. For a fleeting second, I was tempted to turn the moment into the major crisis of the week, but, thankfully, I let it pass. A few days later we went to a school function where, to my amazement, I observed the shoelaces of all of the young men were untied. I then realized my son had fallen victim to another fad. I think it was in this same year that I found out it was no longer socially acceptable to go to school with boots, gloves, or earmuffs.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Alternate Voices
talks.synopsis: Last summer, at a Pioneer parade in Wyoming, I saw a young colt separated from its mother. The lost youngster whinnied and trotted about, listening to a chorus of voices as it sought the voice that would guide it back to the side of the one it loved.

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: The Gift of the Holy Ghost—A Sure Compass
talks.synopsis: I rejoice in the historic action taken at this session of conference, and with all my heart I welcome the new Seventies into the brotherhood of the General Authorities.

talks.author: Richard G. Scott
talks.title: Trust in the Lord
talks.synopsis: I speak to you who want to do right, to you who have had those stirrings in your heart to live worthily no matter what others may say, and to you who want to have such feelings. You are the finest generation that has ever come to earth. We’re proud of you. I have a burning desire to communicate truths which, if understood and lived, will fundamentally change your life. I ask you to help me. Will you listen with your mind and your heart, so that my prayer that you will be helped can be answered?

talks.author: John H. Groberg
talks.title: The Beauty and Importance of the Sacrament
talks.synopsis: One of the most important invitations ever issued to us and to all mankind is to “come unto Christ and be perfected in him.” (.) How do we do that? One of the most beautiful and important ways is through the ordinance of the sacrament.

talks.author: Russell C. Taylor
talks.title: Making Points for Righteousness
talks.synopsis: As the first member of the First Quorum of the Seventy sustained into the Second Quorum of the Seventy in this dispensation, I echo support and sustain this historic action and would want all to know I feel it an honor to serve in this or any capacity in the kingdom of God.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Go For It!
talks.synopsis: Brethren, you are an inspiring sight to behold. It is awesome to realize that in thousands of chapels throughout the world at this hour, your fellow holders of the priesthood of God are receiving this broadcast by way of satellite transmission. Your nationalities vary, and your languages are many, but a common thread binds us together. We have been entrusted to bear the priesthood and to act in the name of God. We are the recipients of a sacred trust. Much is expected of us.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: Magnify Your Calling
talks.synopsis: My brethren, this has been a great meeting. I add my congratulations to our beloved President, Ezra Taft Benson, on the recognition he has received. It is an honor well deserved, and it compliments not only him but also the entire Church.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Thanks Be to God
talks.synopsis: In the first section of the Doctrine and Covenants, we read the Lord’s promise:

talks.author: Boyd K. Packer
talks.title: To Young Women and Men
talks.synopsis: President Monson has reminded us that this is a worldwide church. I once received a clipping from a newspaper in India reporting something I had said to young people at this pulpit. Among those who now listen, or who may later read what we say, are young men and women, in many lands, struggling through those wonderful, worrisome teenage years. I meet teenagers all over the world, in perhaps seventy countries by now. I have stayed in the homes where you live—from tiny houses propped up on poles in the jungle to luxury city apartments.

talks.author: J. Richard Clarke
talks.title: Our Kindred Family—Expression of Eternal Love
talks.synopsis: My brothers and sisters, since last October it has been my blessing to be associated with the Family History Department of the Church. It enables each of us to experience the joy of the covenants and the ordinances of the temple as we make them available to our loved ones.

talks.author: Neal A. Maxwell
talks.title: Irony: The Crust on the Bread of Adversity
talks.synopsis: What I now read is a most wintry verse indeed: “Nevertheless the Lord seeth fit to chasten his people; yea, he trieth their patience and their faith.” (.)

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: Let Love Be the Lodestar of Your Life
talks.synopsis: We’ve had a wonderful morning where the Spirit of the Lord has been felt. I pray for a continuation of that Spirit.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: The Canker of Contention
talks.synopsis: Some months ago my esteemed colleague Elder Carlos E. Asay and I stood atop Mount Nebo, where Moses once stood. (See .) We saw what he saw. In the distance to our right was the Sea of Galilee. The river Jordan flowed from there to the Dead Sea on our left. Ahead was the promised land into which Joshua led the Israelite faithful so long ago.

talks.author: F. Enzio Busche
talks.title: University for Eternal Life
talks.synopsis: I am overwhelmed with feelings of joy and deep gratitude to be able to participate in this gathering of the Saints of the latter days in this great conference. It is impossible to describe with words the feelings that Sister Busche and I share as we are now serving in the second year in one of the temples of the Lord. The dimensions of its sacredness and holiness continue to inspire us every day.

talks.author: Joy F. Evans
talks.title: “Lord, When Saw We Thee an Hungred?”
talks.synopsis: We read in the book of Matthew that when the Son of Man shall come in his glory, all the nations of the earth shall be gathered before him and he shall separate them one from another, as a shepherd divides the sheep from the goats. Those on his right hand shall be blessed and shall inherit the kingdom prepared for them from the foundation of the world. (See .) And the King shall say unto them:

talks.author: Royden G. Derrick
talks.title: The Way to Perfection
talks.synopsis: In October of 1833, the Prophet Joseph Smith received a revelation in which the Lord said, “I will raise up unto myself a pure people, that will serve me in righteousness.” (.) The Lord was speaking of our pioneer forefathers, and also of the Saints of this day. In view of that implied responsibility, I would like to discuss with you today the way to perfection, which not only applies to this life but to the next one as well.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: The Effects of Television
talks.synopsis: This has been another wonderful conference, brothers and sisters. I am sure we all appreciate the inspired and timely messages we have heard. They have been translated simultaneously into twenty-nine languages, many of which have been broadcast via satellite and television to millions of people.

talks.author: Ezra Taft Benson
talks.title: To the Children of the Church
talks.synopsis: My dear brethren and sisters, how I have rejoiced in the messages I have heard delivered from this pulpit at this great general conference of the Church.

talks.author: Ezra Taft Benson
talks.title: To the Elderly in the Church
talks.synopsis: (Read by President Thomas S. Monson, Second Counselor in the First Presidency)

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: Continuous Revelation
talks.synopsis: I wish to speak today of a special dimension of the gospel: the necessity for constant communication with God through the process known as divine revelation. This principle is basic to our belief. President Wilford Woodruff declared: “Whenever the Lord had a people on the earth that He acknowledged as such, that people were led by revelation” (In 24:240.) I affirm at the beginning that the inspiration of God is available to all who worthily seek the guidance of the Holy Spirit. This is particularly true of those who have received the gift of the Holy Ghost.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Remembrance and Gratitude
talks.synopsis: Many of you have had the same experience I have had. And if you haven’t, you will: you will go to a hospital or to a house to comfort someone, and instead they comfort you. Or you try to encourage someone who seems to you to have so little, and yet they will express gratitude for things you take for granted.

talks.author: Boyd K. Packer
talks.title: Revelation in a Changing World
talks.synopsis: Following baptism, one is confirmed a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in a brief ordinance, during which there is conferred the gift of the Holy Ghost. Thereafter, all through life, men, women, even little children receive the right to inspired direction to guide them in their lives—personal revelation! (See .)

talks.author: Howard W. Hunter
talks.title: The Golden Thread of Choice
talks.synopsis: I am honored to greet a vast audience of members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, many of whom are gathered here on Temple Square in Salt Lake City. However, I am aware that by means of modern television technology and the courtesy of a number of television stations, I am privileged also to speak to many who are not members of our church and who may not be familiar with all of its doctrines and beliefs.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Woman—Of Infinite Worth
talks.synopsis: Words are inadequate to express the gratitude we feel for these brethren who have just been released from active assignment as General Authorities of the Church. We appreciate their marvelous ministry and powerful influence for good in the world.

talks.author: W. Eugene Hansen
talks.title: Love
talks.synopsis: My beloved brothers and sisters, since this is my first opportunity to address you since the call to this new assignment, I want you to know how grateful I am for the privilege of serving the Lord and dedicating my life to the building of the kingdom.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: “He Loved Them unto the End”
talks.synopsis: I join with Elder Hansen and all of my brethren newly called to the quorums of the Seventy in expressing gratitude to the Lord for the privilege of this holy calling and opportunity to serve. There is no sufficient way to express either the sense of responsibility or feelings of inadequacy one has in being called to such a ministry. In these many weeks of self-examination, I have repeatedly felt, as Paul once wrote, “pressed out of measure, [and stretched] above strength.” (.)

talks.author: Marlin K. Jensen
talks.title: “An Eye Single to the Glory of God”
talks.synopsis: Brothers and sisters, I am grateful for the opportunity to greet all of you and to tell you how thankful I am to have been called as a member of the First Quorum of the Seventy. My wife, Kathy, says she always knew I would receive a life sentence of some type, but neither of us dreamed it would be something so rewarding!

talks.author: Carlos H. Amado
talks.title: Overcoming Adversity
talks.synopsis: The day I arrived in Mexico City as a General Authority with my family, I received a telephone call from a former missionary companion who wanted to talk to me that night. His oldest son, who was just starting his first semester of college, had died in a tragic accident. He was only seventeen years old and full of enthusiasm for life. He was faithful in the Church, and a seminary graduate. Just two weeks before, he had talked to his parents about desires and goals in life. Now he was gone. They understand the plan of salvation well and are sealed for eternity, but the physical separation affects them.

talks.author: Richard G. Scott
talks.title: Learning to Recognize Answers to Prayer
talks.synopsis: Across from me a woman sat sobbing. With tear-filled eyes, she told me, “I don’t know what I believe anymore.” She spoke of having struggled and prayed many days to know how to make a vitally important decision in her life, without success. She anguished, “I don’t know what to do. If you’ll tell me what to do, I’ll do it.” With her hand on the scriptures, she said, “God told us He would help us. He answers everybody else’s prayers. Why won’t He answer mine?”

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Duties, Rewards, and Risks
talks.synopsis: My brothers and sisters, since April’s general conference, some of our missionaries have found themselves in increasingly more difficult circumstances. As the adviser to the South America North Area Presidency, I was saddened, as I know you were, at the news that two faithful missionaries, Elder Todd Ray Wilson and Elder Jeffrey Brent Ball, lost their lives in Bolivia. The deaths of these two righteous young men while they were in the service of the Lord caused the entire Church membership to mourn. We grieve also for other missionaries who have died from illness or accident since the first of the year.

talks.author: Marvin J. Ashton
talks.title: “Stalwart and Brave We Stand”
talks.synopsis: Many years ago I had the opportunity of witnessing a state-championship high-school track meet at Brigham Young University. The lesson I learned as I watched the mile run was most impressive. I know I shall never forget it. About a dozen young men had qualified to represent their schools. The starting gun was fired, and these young men who had trained so long and so hard took off. Four fellows, closely bunched together, took the early lead. Suddenly the runner in second place spiked the first runner’s foot with his shoe. As the leader was about to make the next stride forward, he found that he was without a shoe.

talks.author: Robert L. Backman
talks.title: Chastity: The Source of True Manhood
talks.synopsis: One day I sat with a handsome, young, prospective missionary as he poured out his sad story through sobs of sorrow, anguish, and remorse. I wanted to cry with him. Pressured by his so-called friends, he found himself at a mixed party where liquor was served. Against everything he knew to be right, he succumbed to the taunts and jeers of all those present, became drunk, and before the evening was over, lost his virtue.

talks.author: Ben B. Banks
talks.title: The Value of Preparation
talks.synopsis: I would like to address my remarks this evening to you young men of the Aaronic and Melchizedek priesthoods who are planning on or contemplating serving a mission, and to those young men of the Aaronic or Melchizedek priesthoods who perhaps might be struggling as to whether or not they want to serve a mission.

talks.author: Joe J. Christensen
talks.title: Good Memories Are Real Blessings
talks.synopsis: Brethren, it’s a marvelous privilege to be with you this evening. I’ve appreciated so much the messages that we have heard.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: The Service That Counts
talks.synopsis: While driving to the office one morning, I passed a dry-cleaning establishment which had a sign by the side of the front door. It read, “It’s the Service That Counts.” I suppose in a highly competitive field such as the dry-cleaning business and many others, the differentiating factor which distinguishes one store from another is, in actual fact, service.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: The Scourge of Illicit Drugs
talks.synopsis: Brethren, this has been a wonderful meeting, in which we have been stirred and uplifted and motivated, and I pray for a continuation of the Spirit of the Lord.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: An Ensign to the Nations
talks.synopsis: My brothers and sisters, I very much appreciate Brother Cuthbert’s prayer. It is always an awesome responsibility to speak in this historic Tabernacle. I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit.

talks.author: David B. Haight
talks.title: The Sacrament—and the Sacrifice
talks.synopsis: I pray for your faith and prayers that my utterances will be received and understood “by the Spirit of truth” and that my expressions will be given “by the Spirit of truth” so that we might all be “edified and rejoice together.” (See .)

talks.author: Dean L. Larsen
talks.title: Winding Up Our Spiritual Clocks
talks.synopsis: Since the announcement yesterday of the change of status of some of the members of the Seventies quorums, I have been trying to think of words that might appropriately pay tribute to these good men. I’ve concluded that words are inadequate and that in reality their real tribute will be found in the lives of people throughout the earth who have been touched by their influence, which influence will continue for generations to come. We love these men with a love that will not be diminished, even though our contact with some of them will not be as frequent as in the past. We acknowledge that they have pioneered many of the aspects of the Church in many parts of the world. And now they are pioneering a new course that some of the rest of us will soon follow. They go with our love, our prayers, our deep respect and admiration, and our eternal gratitude.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Modern Pioneers
talks.synopsis: The days of the pioneers are not past. There are modern pioneers whose achievements are an inspiration to all of us.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Windows
talks.synopsis: While waiting my turn at an airline office in London, England, I reached forward from my chair and selected an advertising brochure from the small table which contained reading material. The publication bore the title, Each page contained a framed picture of a well-known and beautiful site, accompanied by a well-written description which made one desire to visit all of the locations shown. The Matterhorn in Switzerland, the Alps of New Zealand, even the Taj Mahal of India—all seemed to suggest to the reader the desirability of an immediate visit.

talks.author: L. Tom Perry
talks.title: “The Peaceable Followers of Christ”
talks.synopsis: Colonel Thomas L. Kane, a nonmember of the Church, spoke to the Historical Society of Philadelphia, as recorded in the memoirs of John R. Young. He told them that during his travels a few years before, he had passed through a very unusual city named Nauvoo, a community established on the banks of the Mississippi. He explained that after traveling up the river for some time, he left the steamer and began to travel on land because of the rapids in the river.

talks.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
talks.title: Running Your Marathon
talks.synopsis: My beloved brethren and sisters, I pray for that same Spirit that we have enjoyed so much during this conference. I should like today to address my remarks to the youth, to those of you who still have before you the greater part of this journey we call life. I hope you have decided to follow the course marked by our Savior and his teachings. Following that course requires great effort and the help of the Lord at each step along the way. I promise you that his help always is there.

talks.author: Victor L. Brown
talks.title: A Lifetime of Learning
talks.synopsis: Twenty-eight years ago today, to my total surprise, my professional life took a completely different direction. I had spent twenty-one years in the commercial aviation industry, and I enjoyed it. We had just moved into a new home in Chicago when a call came from Church headquarters inviting me to come to Salt Lake City for an interview with President David O. McKay. All my prior plans were discarded as I was called to be a Counselor to the new Presiding Bishop, John H. Vandenberg. I had never thought nor aspired to become a General Authority, but there was only one answer possible when President McKay, a prophet of God, called me to this work.

talks.author: Jayne B. Malan
talks.title: The Summer of the Lambs
talks.synopsis: The day school was out at the beginning of each summer, our family went to our ranch in Wyoming. It was there with my parents and brothers and sisters, and a few cousins mixed in, that I learned about family loyalty; love and concern; birth and death; that one must finish a job once it is started; and, to quote my father, “There are only two things important—the family and the Church.”

talks.author: F. Arthur Kay
talks.title: Keep the Faith
talks.synopsis: My beloved brothers and sisters, this is indeed a challenge and an opportunity, a privilege that I had not anticipated and yet one of those great opportunities to do that which I have been called to do for the past five years—and that is to bear witness of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.

talks.author: John Sonnenberg
talks.title: Look to the Savior
talks.synopsis: My beloved brothers and sisters, I am grateful for this opportunity that is mine to bear witness of the divinity of this great work and testify to all the world that we are led by a prophet of God. I don’t think I’ve heard any more convincing words of love than those I’ve heard when I’ve been in the temple with President Benson and his dedicated counselors and he says, “I love you, my Brethren. I love every one of you.” From the depths of his heart, he has proclaimed to us the true significance of love for our fellowmen.

talks.author: Neal A. Maxwell
talks.title: “Murmur Not”
talks.synopsis: With all of you, I express my admiration to these wonderful men who are being released and whose status is being adjusted. They were exemplary at the time of their calls; they are even more so today. They are portable sermons for us all. My sermon was essentially prepared in June. It is for myself as well as for the members of the Church.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: A Word of Benediction
talks.synopsis: We come now to the conclusion of this great conference. President Benson asked President Monson in the opening session to read a message from him, which was beautiful and inclusive and of great value to us. He has felt that he would not speak in this session.

talks.author: Elaine L. Jack
talks.title: Identity of a Young Woman
talks.synopsis: The favorite part of my calling as a counselor in the Young Women General Presidency is getting acquainted with you young women when I visit your activities, your camps and conferences, and you tell me what’s important to you—about your goals, your projects, your friends, what’s hard for you. I love to listen to you sing “I Walk by Faith.” I get choked up when I hear that. I see you as good, and I see your great potential.

talks.author: Joanne B. Doxey
talks.title: “Remember Him”
talks.synopsis: My beloved sisters—you who belong to the worldwide sisterhood of the Church and you who are yet to become members, you who are women and you girls who are yet to become women, you who are now mothers and you who are yet to become mothers—despite our varied backgrounds and our differences in status and standing, we all are alike in one important respect. We are all sisters, daughters of God, with a common purpose, which is to return to Him with honor after our earth life.

talks.author: Michaelene P. Grassli
talks.title: Follow Him
talks.synopsis: Have you Primary girls ever wondered what your life is going to be like as you grow up? What do you dream of? Ten-year-old Amy told me, “I dream about what I will be like, and where I will go, and what I will do.” Eleven-year-old Kristine said, “I worry about bad things that happen at school. Some things scare me!”

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: Rise to the Stature of the Divine within You
talks.synopsis: This Tabernacle has never looked so beautiful as it does on the occasion of these women’s meetings. Thank you for being here. It’s a very difficult act to follow these three able and dedicated women. I commend to you what they have spoken to us this evening. Their words have been inspiring.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Conference Is Here
talks.synopsis: President Benson has suggested that I commence this conference with a brief message given in his behalf and that I convey to listeners and viewers far and near his greeting, his love, and his blessing.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Small and Simple Things
talks.synopsis: Brothers and sisters, I suppose you are as amazed as I am with the monumental world events that we see unfolding. As Latter-day Saints, we recognize the hand of God working to bring about his purposes in the earth. We know that the “stone [that] was cut out without hands” will continue to roll forth to fill the whole earth. (See .) These are exciting times to be alive.

talks.author: Rex D. Pinegar
talks.title: “Home First”
talks.synopsis: Several weeks ago in a neighborhood not far from my home, dozens of bright, yellow balloons were seen floating from every tree branch and light post lining a winding, three-block road. It was a beautiful sight on that hazy winter day. Senses were stirred as one drove with anticipation along that friendly, colorful street. Around each bend in the road rose the yellow balloons, waving upward to the top of the hill where they warmly proclaimed: “WELCOME HOME, BRIGHAM!” I had heard of Brigham Fordham only a few months ago when I was told of this young eighteen-year-old’s tragic accident that left him paralyzed. I only now discovered that this was his home and his homecoming from the hospital.

talks.author: Derek A. Cuthbert
talks.title: The Spirituality of Service
talks.synopsis: President Benson, who speaks for the Lord to all the world, has challenged us to “live by the Spirit and teach by the Spirit.” How many times have we heard him say, “It’s the Spirit that counts in this work”? Yes, the Lord’s work is spiritual work. It relates to changing lives, developing true values, and overcoming worldly influences.

talks.author: Richard P. Lindsay
talks.title: “Ye Have Done It unto Me”
talks.synopsis: This past year has given me a new vision of the Savior’s words as recorded in Matthew:

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: “Thus Shall My Church Be Called”
talks.synopsis: Today I would like to speak about a name. We are all pleased when our names are pronounced and spelled correctly. Sometimes a nickname is used instead of the real name. But a nickname may offend either the one named or the parents who gave the name.

talks.author: L. Tom Perry
talks.title: Family Traditions
talks.synopsis: Thank you, Brother Bowden, for that beautiful number. That’s a difficult one to follow.

talks.author: Wilford G. Edling
talks.title: The Church Audit Committee Report
talks.synopsis: To the First Presidency of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

talks.author: David B. Haight
talks.title: Filling the Whole Earth
talks.synopsis: We have just had the privilege of sustaining, with our uplifted hands and deep affection, Ezra Taft Benson as God’s living prophet, his inspired counselors, and members of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles as prophets, seers, and revelators, and the other General Authorities of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. And, of course, we acknowledge those other changes made in the auxiliary organizations. We have heard the statistical report indicating a continuing worldwide growth of the Church, with its stabilizing influence, which is the product of the inspired doctrine and policies of the Church.

talks.author: Hans B. Ringger
talks.title: “Choose You This Day”
talks.synopsis: After the resurrection of Christ, the Twelve Apostles preached the gospel in the city of Jerusalem. Their message touched the hearts of many people, and, upon testifying of the truthfulness of the Resurrection, they were asked, “Men and brethren, what shall we do?” (.)

talks.author: Spencer J. Condie
talks.title: Some Scriptural Lessons on Leadership
talks.synopsis: I wish to extend a warm welcome to the new members of the Church who “are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellowcitizens with the saints, and of the household of God.” (.)

talks.author: F. Melvin Hammond
talks.title: The Resurrection
talks.synopsis: My beloved brothers and sisters, today I am happy to express to you the genuine love of the members of the Church in the South America North Area and of your wonderful missionary sons and daughters, young and old, who constantly say to me, “Elder Hammond, when you see our dear prophet, please tell him that we love him. And when you speak in a general conference of the Church, please tell the Saints that our love of the Savior is united firmly with theirs.” They are all so wonderful, and I am pleased to comply with their loving request.

talks.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
talks.title: Personal Integrity
talks.synopsis: In a revelation the Lord said, “Blessed is my servant Hyrum Smith; for I, the Lord, love him because of the integrity of his heart, and because he loveth that which is right.” (.) I personally know of no higher praise that any man could receive.

talks.author: Neal A. Maxwell
talks.title: “Endure It Well”
talks.synopsis: May I add my personal welcome to those brethren and sisters newly sustained today. What has happened today would not have occurred had you not married so well spiritually so many years ago.

talks.author: Boyd K. Packer
talks.title: The Library of the Lord
talks.synopsis: Brethren, it is an awesome responsibility to speak to you young men who hold the Aaronic, or the preparatory priesthood, and to you our brethren who hold the higher priesthood—the Melchizedek Priesthood, the Priesthood after the Holiest Order of God, or the Holy Priesthood after the Order of the Son of God, as the scriptures describe it. I hope to call to your attention some things that we take for granted—some sacred things.

talks.author: Robert D. Hales
talks.title: The Aaronic Priesthood: Return with Honor
talks.synopsis: My dear brethren, I appreciate the opportunity of speaking this evening as a bishop. I would like to talk about the Aaronic Priesthood—first, what it is not. It is not an activity; and second, it is not a priesthood in which we advance because of age. We are advanced in the priesthood because of worthiness.

talks.author: Kenneth Johnson
talks.title: The Motorcycle Ride
talks.synopsis: I know that this life is the time for men to prepare to meet God. I just didn’t plan to be this close so early.

talks.author: Clinton L. Cutler
talks.title: The Greatest Joy
talks.synopsis: My dear brethren, these past few days I have taken a stroll down memory lane. I went back forty-seven years ago in my memory to this sacred building where, as a deacon, members of my quorum and myself rode the bus from Midvale to attend general conference. In those days during the war years of World War II, we could arrive here at ten minutes to the hour and still have a seat. I remember the feelings we had in those years, as the Brethren didn’t enter the pulpit area from the rear; they would walk up the aisles. I recall one Sunday that as we stood outside, a big, tall brother entered through the little gate on the east of Temple Square. It was President George Albert Smith, then serving as President of the Quorum of the Twelve. He walked up to us and visited with us and patted us on the shoulder. I have never forgotten the feelings I had when an Apostle of the Lord took the time to talk to four deacons in from the farm.

talks.author: Malcolm S. Jeppsen
talks.title: Who Is a True Friend?
talks.synopsis: A year ago when I was called as a Seventy, a nonmember patient of mine asked me an interesting question. She wanted to know if a Seventy was higher or lower in the Mormon church than a bishop. When I asked her why she would ask such a question, she replied that she was interested to know just what I’d be doing. She said she understood that in the Mormon church, every calling from a bishop on down was all work, and everyone from a bishop on up was all talk. This may be the reason for my wanting to tonight, to you Aaronic Priesthood brethren.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: My Brother’s Keeper
talks.synopsis: The Holy Bible is an inspiration to me. This sacred book has inspired the minds of men and has motivated readers to live the commandments of God and to love one another. It is printed in greater quantities, is translated into more languages, and has touched more human hearts than any other volume.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: Keeping the Temple Holy
talks.synopsis: Brethren, I commend to you that which we have heard from those who have spoken to us this evening. We have received much of counsel and inspiration, applicable to both men and boys.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: “A Little Child Shall Lead Them”
talks.synopsis: During the Galilean ministry of our Lord and Savior, the disciples came unto Him, saying, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

talks.author: Howard W. Hunter
talks.title: Standing As Witnesses of God
talks.synopsis: As I think of the blessings God has given us and the many beauties of the gospel of Jesus Christ, I am aware that along the way we are asked to make certain contributions in return, contributions of time or of money or of other resources. These are all valued and all necessary, but they do not constitute our full offering to God. Ultimately, what our Father in Heaven will require of us is more than a contribution; it is a total commitment, a complete devotion, all that we are and all that we can be.

talks.author: Carlos E. Asay
talks.title: “One Small Step for a Man; One Giant Leap for Mankind”
talks.synopsis: I pray for the influence of the Holy Spirit as I discuss with you a most sacred subject—a subject that I hope will have special significance to those of you who may be investigating the Church. On July 20, 1969, astronauts landed on the moon, a planet located some 239,000 miles from the earth. Millions of people the world over witnessed this historic event on television and stared in amazement as the lunar module came to rest on the moon’s surface. All were thrilled when Neil Armstrong exited from the space craft and announced: “One small step for a man; one giant leap for mankind.”

talks.author: Marvin J. Ashton
talks.title: “Neither Boast of Faith Nor of Mighty Works”
talks.synopsis: When I was a boy, I liked to hear about King Arthur. In the story of King Arthur, Queen Guinevere gives this advice to Lancelot, the bravest of the Knights of the Round Table: “For I would not have you declare yourself to the world until you have proved your worthiness. Wherefore do not yourself proclaim your name, but wait until the world proclaimeth it.”

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: Blessed Are the Merciful
talks.synopsis: My brethren and sisters, I sense the awesome burden of speaking to you in this great conference. Tens of thousands of you are listening with great expectation here in the Tabernacle, or in your homes, or in more than two thousand Church buildings. May I say at the outset that I love you as my brethren and sisters of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. I love you for your faith and faithfulness. I love you for the integrity of your lives. I love you for your desire to live as the Lord would have you live and for the effort you are making to do so.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: World Peace
talks.synopsis: Some years ago, an acquaintance of mine who was moving to Washington, D.C., went to the district offices to take the driver’s license examination. He had to fill out a form that asked for his business address and his occupation. He had just been appointed a justice of the United States Supreme Court, so he used that as his business address. In the blank marked “occupation” he wrote the word The person at the counter examined this answer, frowned, and said, “Justice? Justice! Well, I guess that’s all right. Last week a fellow wrote ”

talks.author: Richard G. Scott
talks.title: Finding the Way Back
talks.synopsis: The purpose of this message is to help many of you find the life you want, not the one you are living.

talks.author: Barbara W. Winder
talks.title: Instruments to Accomplish His Purposes
talks.synopsis: My dear brothers and sisters, my heart is full to capacity. As we have been released in the normal rotation of assignments, we want to welcome those who have been newly called and to offer them our love and sincere support.

talks.author: Elaine L. Jack
talks.title: “I Will Go and Do”
talks.synopsis: My dear brothers and sisters, first let me affirm my belief in the words of Nephi: “I will go and do the things which the Lord hath commanded, for I know that the Lord giveth no commandments unto the children of men, save he shall prepare a way … that they may accomplish the thing which he commandeth them.” (.)

talks.author: Horacio A. Tenorio
talks.title: Teachings of a Loving Father
talks.synopsis: Our Heavenly Father loves us dearly and watches over us in all our needs and cares, following us through life step by step.

talks.author: Merlin R. Lybbert
talks.title: A Latter-day Samaritan
talks.synopsis: My dear brothers and sisters, there is a feeling of deep appreciation in my soul this afternoon as we worship together. On behalf of the members of the Church in Asia, where we are now serving, I extend their love to President Benson and to the other leaders that they have come to know and love, and to all of the members of the Church everywhere. It is a joy to serve among them.

talks.author: H. Burke Peterson
talks.title: Preparing the Heart
talks.synopsis: My brothers and sisters, I am mindful that there are many who are struggling with faith and testimony. Some have even laid aside celestial pursuits because of weariness in the battle. I pray that I might be guided in my efforts to help.

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: Gratitude As a Saving Principle
talks.synopsis: In the closing moments of this conference, I come to this pulpit to speak about gratitude as an expression of faith and as a saving principle. The Lord has said, “And in nothing doth man offend God, or against none is his wrath kindled, save those who confess not his hand in all things, and obey not his commandments.” (.) It is clear to me from this scripture that to “thank the Lord thy God in all things” () is more than a social courtesy; it is a binding commandment.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: “Sacred Resolves”
talks.synopsis: Brethren and sisters, traditionally the President of the Church, at the close of the conference, has offered words of benediction. President Benson, who is now in his ninety-first year, feels that he could not stand and address us, but I wish to say that we have been greatly uplifted by his very presence, with his smile and the wave of a hand as an expression of love.

talks.author: Boyd K. Packer
talks.title: Teach Them Correct Principles
talks.synopsis: At the first of the year, an announcement went out that had a major effect on the budgeting of the Church. It related to the activities and operation expenses of the local units being paid for henceforth from the tithes and offerings of the Church.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: The Lord’s Way
talks.synopsis: As a foundation for my remarks this evening, I turn to the scriptures, that we might concentrate our thoughts on a passage familiar to most and applicable to all.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: Rise to a Larger Vision of the Work
talks.synopsis: My beloved brethren and sisters, I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit. I am grateful for what Elder Packer and President Monson have said, and commend their words to you.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: “This Work Will Go Forward”
talks.synopsis: My brethren and sisters, it has been customary for the President of the Church to speak at the opening of the conference. President Benson has asked that I say a few words on his behalf. In doing so, I quote his own language:

talks.author: Richard G. Scott
talks.title: Redemption: The Harvest of Love
talks.synopsis: One hundred and fifty years ago this week, the Lord revealed to His prophet Joseph Smith sublime doctrine concerning the sacred ordinance of baptism. That light came when other Christian churches taught that death irrevocably, eternally, determined the destiny of the soul. The baptized were rewarded with endless joy. All others faced eternal torment, without hope of redemption. The Lord’s revelation that baptism could be performed vicariously for the dead, through proper priesthood authority, preserved the justice of His statement: “Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.” (.)

talks.author: Glenn L. Pace
talks.title: A Thousand Times
talks.synopsis: How many of you parents have had an experience similar to this: You are relaxing for the first time at the end of a long day. Suddenly, the silence and serenity of the moment are shattered by the piercing scream of one of your children. You bolt out of your comfortable chair and meet your child who is running hysterically up the front steps. It is obvious there is a cut that will require stitches. In a fraction of a second you form an opinion of what took place. Consequently, the first words out of your mouth, rather than words of sympathy and comfort, are, “Oh, son, why can’t you be more careful? When are you going to learn to mind me? I’ve told you a thousand times not to play on the garage roof!” Our children will testify that none of us ever claims to have told them two, three, nine, or fifteen times. We always claim to have told them a thousand times.

talks.author: Eduardo Ayala
talks.title: The Word of Wisdom
talks.synopsis: Dear brothers and sisters, throughout my life I have known men and women who keep the commandments of the Lord with diligence and joy and who have, through their examples, edified and blessed the lives of those around them. Some of them now occupy prominent, challenging positions in their personal and professional lives. In the midst of their success, they are not afraid of recognizing that they are where they are because of the blessings of the Lord.

talks.author: LeGrand R. Curtis
talks.title: Happiness Is Homemade
talks.synopsis: A month ago we experienced an important event in our lives. Our oldest grandchild was married for time and eternity in the Salt Lake Temple. As that beautiful young lady knelt in the temple with a fine young man, many hopes and blessings were realized—for that young couple, the realization of the tremendous blessings of the temple ordinances; and for their parents, the fulfillment of years of teaching and loving. My wife, Patricia, and I felt many blessings as that group assembled, which included our eight children and their spouses.

talks.author: Neal A. Maxwell
talks.title: Put Off the Natural Man, and Come Off Conqueror
talks.synopsis: So many times prophets warn about the dangers of selfishness—the inordinate and excessive concern with self. The distance between constant self-pleasing and self-worship is shorter than we think. Stubborn selfishness is actually rebellion against God, because, warned Samuel, “stubbornness is as … idolatry.” (.)

talks.author: Howard W. Hunter
talks.title: “Come unto Me”
talks.synopsis: In his beloved Galilee, that familiar, favored home region of Jesus, the Son of God performed not only his first recorded miracle but went on to perform many great miracles that surely must have astonished and awed the people of Galilee who saw them. He healed a leper, cured the servant of a centurion, stilled a tempest, cast out devils, healed a paralytic, opened the eyes of the blind, and restored a young woman to life who had died.

talks.author: Marvin J. Ashton
talks.title: A Pattern in All Things
talks.synopsis: Over the years I have experienced some uncomfortable times in commercial aircrafts while traveling in turbulent skies. Oftentimes, heavy winds, storms, angry clouds, down drafts, etc., have caused bumpy and anxious moments, particularly when it was time to land. A seasoned pilot gave me comfort once after such an experience when he talked about a landing pattern—the ordered flight path of an aircraft about to touch down. Precise instruments, experience, and trust guide the planes to safety en route and through proper landing and takeoff. “We can’t control the weather or elements, but we can stay within the pattern for safety,” he emphasized.

talks.author: Robert K. Dellenbach
talks.title: Hour of Conversion
talks.synopsis: May I tell you of the hour of my true conversion to the Lord Jesus Christ and his restored gospel. Perhaps my experience will strengthen those who desire a closer relationship with our Father in Heaven and a more profound testimony of the truthfulness of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

talks.author: Harold G. Hillam
talks.title: No More Strangers and Foreigners
talks.synopsis: Some years ago, while I was serving as the mission president in Portugal, several of our missionaries introduced me to their shoeshine man. Their shoes looked so good that I was anxious to meet the man that could put such a shine on missionaries’ shoes. Even though he had not chosen to listen to the missionaries’ message, I considered the shoeshine man my friend, and we visited while he was busy shining my shoes. He indicated that his wife had died, that he had no family, and that about the only pleasure he had in life was seeing people walk away happy with the shoes he had just shined.

talks.author: Helvécio Martins
talks.title: The Value of a Testimony
talks.synopsis: Brothers and sisters, it all began one beautiful night during April of 1972 when Elders Thomas McIntire and Steve Richards knocked on my door. At that time, I was searching for answers to many questions that confused and troubled my spirit. The principles taught that night contained the answers my wife and I had searched for so anxiously.

talks.author: Lynn A. Mickelsen
talks.title: What Is Truth?
talks.synopsis: What is truth? This poignant question was asked by the Roman ruler Pilate as the accused Savior was brought before him declaring, “For this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.” (.) In modern-day revelation, He declared, “Truth is knowledge of things as they are, and as they were, and as they are to come;

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Witnesses of Christ
talks.synopsis: A few months ago, I received a letter from a Church member who posed an unusual question: “Do I have a right to bear testimony of the Savior? Or is that the sole prerogative of the Twelve?” In response, I will share some thoughts on why every member of this Church should bear witness and testimony of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: The Greatest Challenge in the World—Good Parenting
talks.synopsis: My beloved brothers and sisters and friends, I ask for your faith and prayers this afternoon as I feel moved upon to discuss a subject which I have chosen to call the greatest challenge in the world. It has to do with the privilege and responsibility of being good parents. On this subject there are about as many opinions as there are parents, yet there are few who claim to have all of the answers. I am certainly not one of them.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Purity Precedes Power
talks.synopsis: My remarks are directed, primarily, to you young men of the Aaronic Priesthood. The subject is the moral cleanliness of our youth. The leaders of the Church care so deeply about every one of you that I feel an urgent need to warn you once again of the consequences of moral misconduct. At the same time, I want to impress upon you the great promises extended to those who remain morally clean.

talks.author: Marion D. Hanks
talks.title: Changing Channels
talks.synopsis: A few days ago, I enjoyed the challenging experience of speaking to a large group of younger teenagers. Thereafter, I received a special letter from a wonderful mother who, with her husband, a bishop, had accompanied their fourteen-year-old son, with some of his friends, to the meeting. These are the last few words of her letter:

talks.author: J Ballard Washburn
talks.title: Follow the Prophet
talks.synopsis: Brethren, it’s an honor to be with you. I humbly pray for the Spirit to guide the things that I say, that we may look at a few brief events in the life of our prophet and resolve to try harder to be like him, to be true disciples of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Durrel A. Woolsey
talks.title: An Eternal Key
talks.synopsis: My beloved brethren of the priesthood, the Lord Jesus Christ said, “For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?” (.) Could we add, “lose his own soul, and his family”?

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: That We May Touch Heaven
talks.synopsis: One of my most vivid memories is attending priesthood meeting as a newly ordained deacon and singing the opening hymn, “Come, All Ye Sons of God Who Have Received the Priesthood.” Tonight, to this capacity audience assembled in the Tabernacle and in chapels worldwide, I echo the spirit of that special hymn and say to you, Come, all ye sons of God who have received the priesthood; let us consider our callings, let us reflect on our responsibilities, let us determine our duty, and let us follow Jesus Christ, our Lord.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: “In … Counsellors There Is Safety”
talks.synopsis: First let me say that I have appreciated all that has been said in this meeting. Much has been spoken to the young men. I endorse all of it. I hope that you have had impressed upon your minds the counsel you have heard. If you follow it, it will bless your lives, now and through all the years to come.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: Mormon Should Mean “More Good”
talks.synopsis: I’d like to first say that our hearts reach out to the family of former governor Scott Matheson, who died this morning, a man that many of us knew and greatly appreciated. We pray that the Spirit of the Lord will comfort those who grieve.

talks.author: David B. Haight
talks.title: Temples and Work Therein
talks.synopsis: Temples are the most sacred places of worship on earth where sacred ordinances are performed—ordinances which pertain to salvation and exaltation in the kingdom of God. Each one is literally a house of the Lord—a place where He and His spirit may dwell, where He may come or send others to confer priesthood blessings and to give revelation to His people.

talks.author: James M. Paramore
talks.title: The Many Witnesses of Jesus Christ and His Work
talks.synopsis: My beloved brothers and sisters, I love you so much and I seek an interest in your faith and prayers today as I speak a few words to you. Several weeks ago I met a wonderful man while traveling to Texas. May I share with you a letter that I have written to him.

talks.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
talks.title: The Straight and Narrow Way
talks.synopsis: While traveling along a mountainous road one evening through a driving rainstorm punctuated with frequent claps of thunder and flashes of lightning, Sister Wirthlin and I could barely see the road, either in front of us or to the right and the left. I watched the white lines on that road more intently than ever before. Staying within the lines kept us from going onto the shoulder and into the deep canyon on one side and helped us avoid a head-on collision on the other. To wander over either line could have been very dangerous. Then I thought, “Would a right-thinking person deviate to the left or the right of a traffic lane if he knew the result would be fatal? If he valued his mortal life, certainly he would stay between these lines.”

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Days Never to Be Forgotten
talks.synopsis: As the year 1990 moves inexorably toward its close, all members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints can pause and reflect on the momentous happenings that have occurred in our time, in our day, and in our lives.

talks.author: L. Tom Perry
talks.title: “Serve God Acceptably with Reverence and Godly Fear”
talks.synopsis: “Be not afraid.” Thank you, choir, for that extra support.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Choices
talks.synopsis: Not long ago a beautiful young mother asked me for guidance with a very difficult decision she was facing. It pertained to an important surgical operation that was being considered. Consequences of her choice would affect her husband and her family as well. She said, “Decisions are really hard for me. I even have trouble choosing what to wear each morning.”

talks.author: Hartman Rector Jr.
talks.title: The Resurrection
talks.synopsis: Brothers and sisters, I would like to visit with you for a few moments this afternoon about the resurrection and the importance of going home to our Heavenly Father in a clean condition. Surely there is not much known by the living about the resurrection because neither prophets nor resurrected persons have explained the process to mortals. Only this much: that the atonement of Jesus Christ “bringeth to pass the resurrection of the dead” (), death being the separation of the spirit from the body.

talks.author: Ruth B. Wright
talks.title: Draw Strength from the Book of Mormon
talks.synopsis: On the walls of our Primary office hang pictures, drawn by children from around the world, which illustrate some of the great events from the Book of Mormon. As I look at them, I feel the spirit of noble prophets and leaders who made choices to be obedient to the Lord in spite of earthly trials. The examples of their faith, courage, love, humility, service, and endurance sustain me and give me strength to face challenges in my own life.

talks.author: Helio R. Camargo
talks.title: In All Things, Give Thanks
talks.synopsis: Brothers, sisters, and friends, as the Apostle Paul counseled the Thessalonian Saints, “In every thing give thanks” (), today I would like to express my gratitude for some of the special blessings in my life.

talks.author: Waldo P. Call
talks.title: Follow the Prophets
talks.synopsis: In the Old Testament, in 2 Kings, we read of a man by the name of Naaman. He was the “captain of the host of the king of Syria, … but he was a leper.” (.)

talks.author: Boyd K. Packer
talks.title: Covenants
talks.synopsis: It was an experience to hear President Joseph Fielding Smith pray. Even when he was past ninety he would pray that he would “keep his and and endure to the end.” The word is the subject of my message.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: “God Be with You Till We Meet Again”
talks.synopsis: There is a loneliness in the empty chair between President Hinckley and me, and we feel it in our hearts. I wish I could take you with President Hinckley and me to President Benson’s hospital room, which we visited a few days ago. I think the picture of tranquillity and love which was there would be very beneficial for all members of the Church to see. President Benson lay on his hospital bed, his left hand held by a noble son and his right hand by a beautiful daughter as she read to him from the Book of Mormon. In the background, a recording of Tabernacle Choir music played softly. It was just a little bit of heaven.

talks.author: Elaine L. Jack
talks.title: “These Things Are Manifested unto Us Plainly”
talks.synopsis: My dear sisters, it’s been heartwarming for me to receive so many good wishes from you during the past six months and to feel your acceptance. Many of you have told me that you’re praying for our presidency. We feel that spiritual strength and gratefully acknowledge it—both to you and to our Father in Heaven.

talks.author: Betty Jo N. Jepsen
talks.title: Kindness—A Part of God’s Plan
talks.synopsis: My friend, Marcia, had moved several times in her young years as her father’s work required it. She was now ten years old and facing another new school. Marcia’s mother could see the concern on her daughter’s face and sat down with her to discuss what was bothering her.

talks.author: Ardeth G. Kapp
talks.title: “Crickets” Can Be Destroyed through Spirituality
talks.synopsis: My dear young women friends, tonight I want to be sensitive to your feelings. I pray that you will open your hearts and that the Spirit will teach you as I speak to you about some things that are very important, that need to be talked about at this time. I love you. I have great faith in you. President Benson has taught that “you have been born at this time for a sacred and glorious purpose. … Your birth at this particular time was foreordained in the eternities.” ( Nov. 1986, p. 81.) Even so, we have feelings of great anxiety for your welfare.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: The Lighthouse of the Lord
talks.synopsis: My dear sisters, the spirit which permeates this meeting here in the historic Tabernacle and in hundreds of chapels and stake centers in many parts of the world is a reflection of your strength, your devotion, your goodness. To quote the words of the Lord: “Ye are the salt of the earth. … Ye are the light of the world. … Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.” (.)

talks.title: Good-bye to This Wonderful Old Tabernacle

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: What It Means to Be a Daughter of God

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: To All the World in Testimony
talks.synopsis: In this great hall … the voices of prophets will go out to all the world in testimony of the Redeemer of mankind.

talks.author: Boyd K. Packer
talks.title: The Cloven Tongues of Fire
talks.synopsis: In every language, the Spirit of God—the Holy Ghost—guides, or can guide, every member of the Church.

talks.author: Harold G. Hillam
talks.title: Future Leaders
talks.synopsis: I pray that you young people will develop a reverence for sacred things, a respect for your elders, and a willingness to keep the commandments. I pray that you will learn to know of the Savior.

talks.author: Coleen K. Menlove
talks.title: Living Happily Ever After
talks.synopsis: The Savior, Jesus Christ, showed us the way to happiness and told us everything we need to do to be happy.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Resurrection
talks.synopsis: Resurrection is much more than merely reuniting a spirit to a body. … The resurrection is a restoration that brings back “carnal for carnal” and “good for that which is good” (Alma 41:13).

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: The Shield of Faith
talks.synopsis: Never before in the history of the world has the need for faith in God been greater.

talks.author: L. Tom Perry
talks.title: “Thou Shalt Give Heed unto All His Words”
talks.synopsis: The continued expansion of technology will only bring the messages to us. … [But it is] the challenge of each individual and family … to internalize the messages of the gospel.

talks.author: Glenn L. Pace
talks.title: A Temple for West Africa
talks.synopsis: It has been inspiring to see the Lord’s hand in bringing the forces together which will lead to an inevitable victory. There will be a temple in West Africa.

talks.author: Jay E. Jensen
talks.title: Keep an Eternal Perspective
talks.synopsis: If we can help people first understand the plan, they will find a deeper and more permanent motivation to keep the commandments.

talks.author: Gary J. Coleman
talks.title: “Are You Still Here?”
talks.synopsis: I have learned from the scriptures and the living prophets that this life is the time to prepare ourselves to meet God and one day enjoy eternal life with Him.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: “How Is It with Us?”
talks.synopsis: The most important thing every one of us can do is to examine our own commitment and devotion to the Lord Jesus Christ.

talks.author: David B. Haight
talks.title: Faith, Devotion, and Gratitude
talks.synopsis: I hope that we have grateful hearts for the knowledge that we have and the testimonies we have and for the feelings we have.

talks.author: Richard G. Scott
talks.title: The Sanctity of Womanhood
talks.synopsis: Each of us absolutely must help each daughter of God we can to realize what sacred characteristics Father in Heaven has given her.

talks.author: H. David Burton
talks.title: Honoring the Priesthood
talks.synopsis: Priesthood isn’t something we take off during the week and put on for Sunday. It is a 24-7 privilege and blessing—that is, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

talks.author: Angel Abrea
talks.title: Your Own Personal Testimony
talks.synopsis: The Holy Ghost has the power to bring light and understanding to our lives, but we must pay the price to seek and win His companionship.

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: The Power of Self-Mastery
talks.synopsis: Self-mastery … is the ultimate test of our character.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Your Eternal Voyage
talks.synopsis: Let us consider our callings, let us reflect on our responsibilities, let us determine our duty, and let us follow Jesus Christ our Lord.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: The Stake President
talks.synopsis: Stake presidents have been called under the same inspiration under which the General Authorities were called. I pray for these, my beloved brethren, that the Spirit of the Lord will rest upon them.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Your Eternal Home
talks.synopsis: In a very real sense, we are builders of eternal houses. We are apprentices to the trade—not skilled craftsmen. We need divine help if we are to build successfully.

talks.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
talks.title: Finding a Safe Harbor
talks.synopsis: In our own storms in life the Savior is our solace and our sanctuary. If we seek peace, we must come unto Him.

talks.author: Earl C. Tingey
talks.title: The Widows of Zion
talks.synopsis: The Lord loves widows. … [We] should care for and assist the widows within our family, home, ward, and neighborhood.

talks.author: Mary Ellen W. Smoot
talks.title: We Are Creators
talks.synopsis: Create homes filled with love and serenity. Relieve suffering. Create enduring testimonies of eternal truths in ourselves and others.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Watch Over and Strengthen
talks.synopsis: The Savior will let you feel the love He feels for those you serve. The call is an invitation to become like Him.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: My Testimony
talks.synopsis: Of all the things for which I feel grateful … , one stands out preeminently. That is a living testimony of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Neal A. Maxwell
talks.title: Content with the Things Allotted unto Us
talks.synopsis: Life’s necessary defining moments come within our allotments. … Our responses are what matter. Sufficient unto each life are the tests thereof!

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: As Doves to Our Windows
talks.synopsis: May we do as much with the blessings we have been given as [our ancestors] did out of the deprivations so many of them faced. In such abundance may we never “forget the Lord.”

talks.author: Yoshihiko Kikuchi
talks.title: Heavenly Father Has a Special Plan
talks.synopsis: I know that your Heavenly Father has a special plan for you and your family to return to live with Him. Let’s go home.

talks.author: Loren C. Dunn
talks.title: “Because My Father Sent Me”
talks.synopsis: A father succeeds when he steps forward and accepts his commitment as a father, always loving, praying for and doing what he can for his family, and never giving up.

talks.author: John B. Dickson
talks.title: A Brief Introduction to the Church
talks.synopsis: We declare that the great restoration that the ancient prophets spoke of began in 1820 when the Lord called a young man named Joseph Smith to reestablish the Church.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: The Creation
talks.synopsis: Grand as it is, planet Earth is part of something even grander—that great plan of God. Simply summarized, the earth was created that families might be.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: A Time of New Beginnings
talks.synopsis: Let us take a little time to meditate, to think of what we can do to improve our lives and to become better examples of what a Latter-day Saint should be.

talks.author: Sharon G. Larsen
talks.title: Standing with God
talks.synopsis: What does it mean to stand as a witness of God? It means we will not bow down or give in or be persuaded to do anything contrary to God’s will.

talks.author: Carol B. Thomas
talks.title: Integrity
talks.synopsis: Integrity makes you whole and complete.

talks.author: Margaret D. Nadauld
talks.title: Stand as a Witness
talks.synopsis: You have all you need to stand strong and firm and true because you have the Lord on your side.

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: Womanhood: The Highest Place of Honor
talks.synopsis: I promise you dear young sisters that if you live the standards of personal worthiness contained in the Young Women program, great will be your happiness and endless will be your joy.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: A Great Family in Reverence and Worship
talks.synopsis: We speak words of testimony concerning God our Eternal Father and His Beloved Son.

talks.author: Robert D. Hales
talks.title: The Covenant of Baptism: To Be in the Kingdom and of the Kingdom
talks.synopsis: Our Baptism and confirmation is the gateway into His kingdom. When we enter, we covenant to be of His kingdom—forever!

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: The Redemption of the Dead and the Testimony of Jesus
talks.synopsis: By identifying our ancestors and performing for them the saving ordinances they could not themselves perform, we are testifying of the infinite reach of the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Alexander B. Morrison
talks.title: “Come and See”
talks.synopsis: Come seeking to know Him, and I promise you will find Him and see Him in His true character as the risen, redeeming Savior of the world.

talks.author: Loren C. Dunn
talks.title: Testimony
talks.synopsis: I know that God our Father is in this work in great congregations such as this, and in the smallest branch and the smallest congregation God is in this work.

talks.author: Margaret D. Nadauld
talks.title: The Joy of Womanhood
talks.synopsis: Daughters of God know that it is the nurturing nature of women that can bring everlasting blessings, and they live to cultivate this divine attribute.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Living by Scriptural Guidance
talks.synopsis: We all need guidance through life. We obtain it best from the standard works and teachings of the prophets of God.

talks.author: David B. Haight
talks.title: Be a Strong Link
talks.synopsis: As my eyesight dims somewhat, I think my vision improves—my vision of the long road, my vision of what lies ahead.

talks.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
talks.title: Pure Testimony
talks.synopsis: As a special witness of the name of Jesus Christ in all the world, I promise you that if you seek the Lord, you will find Him. Ask, and you shall receive.

talks.author: Richard G. Scott
talks.title: The Path to Peace and Joy
talks.synopsis: Are you taking full advantage of the redeeming power of repentance in your life so that you can have greater peace and joy?

talks.author: Donald L. Hallstrom
talks.title: Cultivate Righteous Traditions
talks.synopsis: Uplifting traditions … that promote love for Deity and unity in families and among people are especially important.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: One by One
talks.synopsis: Embrace the Savior’s warm invitation to come unto Him, one by one, and be perfected in Him.

talks.author: Douglas L. Callister
talks.title: Seeking the Spirit of God
talks.synopsis: As we become more conversant with the Holy Spirit, our lives become refined. The sordid and base have no attraction.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: The Challenge to Become
talks.synopsis: In contrast to the institutions of the world, which teach us to know something, the gospel of Jesus Christ challenges us to become something.

talks.author: Neal A. Maxwell
talks.title: The Tugs and Pulls of the World
talks.synopsis: Many individuals preoccupied by the cares of the world are not necessarily in transgression. But they certainly are in diversion and thus waste “the days of [their] probation” (2 Ne. 9:27).

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: “Sanctify Yourselves”
talks.synopsis: The call in every age—and especially our age—is Joshua’s call: “Sanctify yourselves: for to morrow the Lord will do wonders among you.”

talks.author: Dennis B. Neuenschwander
talks.title: Living Prophets, Seers, and Revelators
talks.synopsis: There is an expanding gulf between the standards of the world and those of the gospel and kingdom of God, and … living prophets will always teach the standards of God.

talks.author: Richard C. Edgley
talks.title: Satan’s Bag of Snipes
talks.synopsis: Will we listen to Satan, the author of all lies … ? Or are we going to believe a loving Heavenly Father, who is the source of all truth and happiness?

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: The Enemy Within
talks.synopsis: Each of us needs to train ourselves to be bold, disciplined, and loyal men of the priesthood who are prepared with the proper weapons to fight against evil and to win.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: The Call to Serve
talks.synopsis: I revere the priesthood of Almighty God. I have witnessed its power. I have seen its strength. I have marveled at the miracles it has wrought.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: “Great Shall Be the Peace of Thy Children”
talks.synopsis: In terms of your happiness, in terms of the matters that make you proud or sad, nothing—I repeat, nothing—will have so profound an effect on you as the way your children turn out.

talks.author: James E. Faust
talks.title: A Growing Testimony
talks.synopsis: As I look back over my life, I recognize one source of singular strength and blessing. It is my testimony and knowledge that Jesus is the Christ.

talks.author: L. Tom Perry
talks.title: Discipleship
talks.synopsis: We must create … ongoing and continual processes that draw us closer to the Lord our Savior so that we can be numbered among His disciples.

talks.author: Virginia U. Jensen
talks.title: “Lead, Kindly Light”
talks.synopsis: The light of Jesus Christ is stronger than any darkness we face in this life, if we have faith in Him, seek after Him, and obey Him.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Dedication Day
talks.synopsis: As an expression of our love for the Lord, could we not rededicate our lives and our homes in a like manner?

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: This Great Millennial Year
talks.synopsis: This work is possessed of a vitality which has never been evidenced before to such a degree.

talks.author: Boyd K. Packer
talks.title: “Ye Are the Temple of God”
talks.synopsis: Your body really is the instrument of your mind and the foundation of your character.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Now Is the Time
talks.synopsis: If we do not … willingly teach others of the Restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ through the Prophet Joseph Smith, who will?

talks.author: Keith Crockett
talks.title: Retaining a Remission of Sin
talks.synopsis: King Benjamin taught three basic principles that can help us retain a remission of our sins: first, to remain humble; second, to call upon the Lord daily; and third, to stand steadfast in the faith.

talks.author: H. Aldridge Gillespie
talks.title: The Blessing of Keeping the Sabbath Day Holy
talks.synopsis: The Latter-day Saints must lead out in sanctifying this appointed day each week.

talks.author: Robert C. Oaks
talks.title: Sharing the Gospel
talks.synopsis: Given the importance of the message, the help offered by the Spirit, the number of the missionaries and the size of the field that is ready to harvest, 300,000 new converts per year is not nearly enough.

talks.author: F. Enzio Busche
talks.title: Freedom “from” or Freedom “to”
talks.synopsis: We … become alive as we take, knowingly, full responsibility for our own life and as we stop blaming circumstances.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: “Write upon My Heart”
talks.synopsis: Prayer can provide the shield of protection the parent will want so much for [a child] to have.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: “An Humble and a Contrite Heart”
talks.synopsis: If we have drawn nearer to the Savior, with a more firm resolution to follow His teachings and His example, then this conference will have been a wonderful success.

talks.author: Mary Ellen W. Smoot
talks.title: We Are Instruments in the Hands of God
talks.synopsis: We don’t need a new program to spur us on—we need only incorporate the desire to share the gospel and reach out to new members and those who are less active.

talks.author: Virginia U. Jensen
talks.title: Ripples
talks.synopsis: The actions of righteous women ripple on and on through time and space and even generations.

talks.author: Sheri L. Dew
talks.title: Stand Tall and Stand Together
talks.synopsis: No woman is a more vibrant instrument in the hands of the Lord than a woman of God who is thrilled to be who she is.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: Your Greatest Challenge, Mother
talks.synopsis: I know of no better answer to [the] foul practices that confront our young people than the teachings of a mother, given in love with an unmistakable warning.

talks.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
talks.title: The Work Goes On
talks.synopsis: Let us be good people. Let us be friendly people. Let us be neighborly people. Let us be what members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints ought to be.

talks.author: Richard G. Scott
talks.title: First Things First
talks.synopsis: Do the best you can while on earth to have an ideal family. To help you do that, ponder and apply the principles in the proclamation on the family.

talks.author: Marlin K. Jensen
talks.title: “To Walk Humbly with Thy God”
talks.synopsis: True humility will inevitably lead us to say to God, “Thy will be done.”

talks.author: Sydney S. Reynolds
talks.title: A God of Miracles
talks.synopsis: I believe that all of us can bear witness to these small miracles.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: “Witnesses unto Me”
talks.synopsis: For those who find it difficult to initiate missionary conversations—and many do—the Church’s newly produced pass-along cards are a lovely, effortless way to let others know some of your basic beliefs and how they may learn more.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Compassion
talks.synopsis: We have no way of knowing when our privilege to extend a helping hand will unfold before us.

talks.author: Boyd K. Packer
talks.title: “The Touch of the Master’s Hand”
talks.synopsis: We all make mistakes. … It is then in our nature to feel guilt and humiliation and suffering, which we alone cannot cure. That is when the healing power of the Atonement will help.

talks.author: Robert D. Hales
talks.title: Couple Missionaries: A Time to Serve
talks.synopsis: It is proper for a mature sister or couple to let their priesthood leaders know that they are willing and able to serve a mission. I urge you to do so.

talks.author: Darwin B. Christenson
talks.title: David, a Future Missionary
talks.synopsis: Given some exposure, our young brothers and young sisters come quite naturally … to a deep love for Jesus and for our prophets.

talks.author: L. Aldin Porter
talks.title: “To Bear Testimony of Mine Only Begotten”
talks.synopsis: A spiritual witness of the Nephite scripture will always bring the certainty of the Savior’s existence.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Personal Preparation for Temple Blessings
talks.synopsis: Those who enter the temple are also to bear the attribute of holiness. … We can acquire holiness only by enduring and persistent personal effort.

talks.author: L. Tom Perry
talks.title: Building a Community of Saints
talks.synopsis: In any community of Saints, we all work to serve each other in the best way we know how. Our work has a higher purpose because it is work to bless others and to build the kingdom of God.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: “Watch with Me”
talks.synopsis: As you watch over His sheep, your love for Him will grow. And that will increase your confidence and your courage.

talks.author: David E. Sorensen
talks.title: You Can’t Pet a Rattlesnake
talks.synopsis: Pornography, though billed by Satan as entertainment, is a deeply poisonous, deceptive snake that lies coiled up in magazines, the Internet, and the television.

talks.author: John H. Groberg
talks.title: Priesthood Power
