talks.synopsis: Elder Johnson tells of his daughter who passed away from cancer. He testifies of the reality of the Savior’s Resurrection and the Resurrection of all mankind.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: Tomorrow the Lord Will Do Wonders among You
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland encourages Church members to do the best they can to live the gospel and testifies that God’s love and help will be with them.

talks.author: Jean B. Bingham
talks.title: I Will Bring the Light of the Gospel into My Home
talks.synopsis: Sister Bingham teaches that we can share the light of the gospel by being kind and nonjudgmental and by developing the gift of charity.

talks.author: Carole M. Stephens
talks.title: The Master Healer
talks.synopsis: Sister Stephens testifies of the Savior’s power to heal us from our sins, from the unrighteous actions of others, and from difficulties of mortality.

talks.author: Bonnie L. Oscarson
talks.title: Rise Up in Strength, Sisters in Zion
talks.synopsis: Sister Oscarson teaches sisters that they need to rise up to become women of faith by studying and having a testimony of the essential doctrines of the gospel.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Fourth Floor, Last Door
talks.synopsis: President Uchtdorf encourages sisters to live in faith, search diligently, walk in righteousness, and seek God with all their hearts.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: O How Great the Plan of Our God!
talks.synopsis: President Uchtdorf urges us not to take for granted the truths of Heavenly Father’s plan of salvation but to remember them with wonder and awe.

talks.author: Robert D. Hales
talks.title: “Come, Follow Me” by Practicing Christian Love and Service
talks.synopsis: Elder Hales encourages followers of Jesus Christ to replace contention with Christlike love and kindness, which will help reduce spiritual suffering.

talks.author: Carol F. McConkie
talks.title: The Soul’s Sincere Desire
talks.synopsis: Sister McConkie teaches that our prayers involve all three members of the Godhead: we pray to the Father in the name of Christ by the power of the Holy Ghost.

talks.author: Craig C. Christensen
talks.title: “A Choice Seer Will I Raise Up”
talks.synopsis: Elder Christensen reminds us that through Joseph Smith’s foretold mission as Prophet of the Restoration, we enjoy the fruits and blessings of the Restoration.

talks.author: Juan A. Uceda
talks.title: The Lord Jesus Christ Teaches Us to Pray
talks.synopsis: Elder Uceda encourages members to pray from the heart, to pray before making important decisions, noting that prayer is a sacred moment.

talks.author: J. Devn Cornish
talks.title: Am I Good Enough? Will I Make It?
talks.synopsis: Elder Cornish explains that as long as we keep trying to live the commandments, repent, and rely on Christ, we will be worthy to return to live with God.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: A Witness of God
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen teaches that we should share the gospel with others by being witnesses of God at all times and in all places.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: Valiant in the Testimony of Jesus
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook teaches that in order for us to be valiant in the testimony of Jesus Christ, we need to avoid the stumbling blocks that can impede our progress.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: Look to the Book, Look to the Lord
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson explains how the Book of Mormon is the keystone of our religion and how members can gain a testimony of it by reading it.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: “Abide in My Love”
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson explains that God’s love is infinite and eternal but His greater blessings are conditioned on obedience.

talks.author: W. Mark Bassett
talks.title: For Our Spiritual Development and Learning
talks.synopsis: Elder Bassett teaches how patience, faith, and obedience can help us gain spiritual knowledge.

talks.author: Kazuhiko Yamashita
talks.title: Be Ambitious for Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Yamashita encourages us to be “ambitious for Christ” by serving faithfully and diligently without complaint and by enduring trials joyfully.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Sharing the Restored Gospel
talks.synopsis: Elder Oaks teaches that sharing the gospel is a joyful privilege and provides ideas to help members fulfill this responsibility effectively.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: Emissaries to the Church
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland reminds priesthood leaders of the importance of caring for individuals and families through heartfelt home teaching.

talks.author: LeGrand R. Curtis Jr.
talks.title: There Is Power in the Book
talks.synopsis: Elder Curtis teaches how developing a testimony of the Book of Mormon can bless our lives and bring us closer to Christ.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Learn from Alma and Amulek
talks.synopsis: President Uchtdorf asks priesthood holders what they can learn from Alma in finding Amuleks, and whether they’ve become like Amulek in their discipleship.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: That He May Become Strong Also
talks.synopsis: President Eyring encourages Melchizedek Priesthood holders to help others, especially Aaronic Priesthood holders, prepare for future service.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: Principles and Promises
talks.synopsis: President Monson testifies of the blessings that come as we obey the Word of Wisdom.

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: The Perfect Path to Happiness
talks.synopsis: President Monson testifies of the truthfulness of the plan of salvation, centered on Jesus Christ. We have a mandate to share and live the truth.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Joy and Spiritual Survival
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches that we can have joy in the midst of any circumstance if we are focused on Jesus Christ and the plan of salvation.

talks.author: Peter F. Meurs
talks.title: The Sacrament Can Help Us Become Holy
talks.synopsis: Elder Meurs teaches how we can better prepare for and participate in the ordinance of the sacrament.

talks.author: Linda S. Reeves
talks.title: The Great Plan of Redemption
talks.synopsis: Sister Reeves shares stories of individuals who feel the peace, joy, and blessings of sincerely repenting and parking of the Savior’s Atonement.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: To Whom Shall We Go?
talks.synopsis: Elder Ballard asks us to consider where we will turn to if we turn away from the Church of Jesus Christ when our faith is tested. If we stay, we are blessed.

talks.author: Dean M. Davies
talks.title: The Blessings of Worship
talks.synopsis: Bishop Davies teaches us what true worship of Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ is and how we can have the blessings that accompany it.

talks.author: Lynn G. Robbins
talks.title: The Righteous Judge
talks.synopsis: Elder Robbins shares the importance of judging in righteousness and of teaching and correcting others with love, as the Savior would.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Gratitude on the Sabbath Day
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches that the Sabbath day is a time to be grateful for blessings and to remember and fulfill our covenant to serve others.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: “If Ye Had Known Me”
talks.synopsis: Elder Bednar describes the process of coming to know the Savior, which includes exercising faith in Him, following Him, serving Him, and believing Him.

talks.author: Brian K. Ashton
talks.title: The Doctrine of Christ
talks.synopsis: Brother Ashton teaches that the doctrine of Christ includes faith, repentance, baptism, the sacrament, the gift of the Holy Ghost, and enduring to the end.

talks.author: Carl B. Cook
talks.title: Serve
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook teaches that although Church callings can be challenging, we are blessed as we serve with faith and dedication.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: Lest Thou Forget
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband speaks to those who seek to fortify their faith, reminding them of God’s love and encouraging them to remember and record spiritual experiences.

talks.author: Evan A. Schmutz
talks.title: God Shall Wipe Away All Tears
talks.synopsis: Elder Schmutz testifies that as we exercise faith in the Savior, He will lift us and carry us through our trials.

talks.author: K. Brett Nattress
talks.title: No Greater Joy Than to Know That They Know
talks.synopsis: Elder Nattress encourages all to help children know and feel the love of Heavenly Father and the Savior.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: Repentance: A Joyful Choice
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund teaches that repentance is a choice we can make because of the Savior’s Atonement and that repenting can lead to joy.

talks.author: Bonnie H. Cordon
talks.title: Trust in the Lord and Lean Not

talks.author: Mark A. Bragg
talks.title: Brighter and Brighter until the Perfect Day

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Drawing the Power of Jesus Christ into Our Lives

talks.author: Robert D. Hales
talks.title: Becoming a Disciple of Our Lord Jesus Christ

talks.author: Gary B. Sabin
talks.title: Stand Up Inside and Be All In

talks.author: Thomas S. Monson
talks.title: The Power of the Book of Mormon

talks.author: L. Whitney Clayton
talks.title: Whatsoever He Saith unto You, Do It

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: The Godhead and the Plan of Salvation

talks.author: Joaquin E. Costa
talks.title: To the Friends and Investigators of the Church

talks.author: S. Mark Palmer
talks.title: Then Jesus Beholding Him Loved Him

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: How Does the Holy Ghost Help You?

talks.author: Benjamín De Hoyos
talks.title: That Our Light May Be a Standard for the Nations

talks.author: Sharon Eubank
talks.title: Turn On Your Light
talks.synopsis: Sister Eubank encourages Latter-day Saint women to follow the charge given by President Spencer W. Kimball to be righteous, articulate, different, and distinct.

talks.author: Neill F. Marriott
talks.title: Abiding in God and Repairing the Breach
talks.synopsis: Sister Marriott shares God‘s invitation to draw near unto Him and testifies of the Savior’s power to close the gap that separates us from Him.

talks.author: Joy D. Jones
talks.title: Value beyond Measure
talks.synopsis: Sister Jones teaches that the Spirit can confirm to us the truth of our divine worth. Our love for the Savior can help us overcome weaknesses and self-doubts.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Three Sisters
talks.synopsis: President Uchtdorf tells a parable of three sisters—sad, mad, and glad—to teach that we are children of God and that the path of discipleship leads to joy.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: A Yearning for Home
talks.synopsis: President Uchtdorf teaches that turning to the Lord will make our lives better and will help us make the lives of others better.

talks.author: Bonnie L. Oscarson
talks.title: The Needs before Us
talks.synopsis: Sister Oscarson teaches us to serve those closest to us: our families, friends, ward and community members. The essence of living the gospel is service.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: The Plan and the Proclamation
talks.synopsis: Elder Oaks describes how the doctrine in the family proclamation helps prepare us for exaltation and guides us through modern challenges that face the family.

talks.author: John C. Pingree Jr.
talks.title: “I Have a Work for Thee”
talks.synopsis: Elder Pingree testifies that God has a work for all of us. He also shares principles to help us perform that work and warns of ways Satan will oppose us.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: The Living Bread Which Came Down from Heaven
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson invites us to pursue holiness by accepting the Savior’s invitation to figuratively partake of His flesh and drink His blood.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: Be Ye Therefore Perfect—Eventually
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland teaches that in responding to the commandment to be perfect, we should not get discouraged but should persevere to achieve the goal in eternity.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: Spiritual Eclipse
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson likens a solar eclipse to a spiritual eclipse. A gospel perspective can help us overcome pride and use social media to inspire others.

talks.author: Stephen W. Owen
talks.title: Repentance Is Always Positive
talks.synopsis: Brother Owen teaches that repentance is a gift offered by the Savior. Like the prodigal son, we make daily choices that will lead us to our Heavenly Father.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: The Eternal Everyday
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook teaches that humility is essential in helping the Lord establish His Church and in helping prepare individuals to meet God.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: By Divine Design
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband explains that our lives are part of the Lord’s divine design and that He will guide us when we strive to be righteous.

talks.author: O. Vincent Haleck
talks.title: The Heart of the Widow
talks.synopsis: Elder Haleck encourages us to have the “widow’s heart,” promising that the Lord will bless us as we do all we can to help to build up the kingdom of God.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: The Book of Mormon: What Would Your Life Be Like without It?
talks.synopsis: President Nelson explains the importance of the Book of Mormon, testifies that it teaches of Christ, and encourages us to prayerfully study it every day.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: The Priesthood and the Savior’s Atoning Power
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund teaches that the role of the priesthood is to deliver to God’s children the opportunity to benefit from the Savior’s atoning power.

talks.author: David F. Evans
talks.title: The Truth of All Things
talks.synopsis: Elder Evans teaches that we can strengthen our testimonies by sincerely seeking answers, studying the scriptures, repenting, and keeping the commandments.

talks.author: Richard J. Maynes
talks.title: Earning the Trust of the Lord and Your Family
talks.synopsis: Elder Maynes teaches that earning the trust of the Lord requires us to first trust Him. Having “integrity of heart” will help us be true to our covenants.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Bearers of Heavenly Light
talks.synopsis: President Uchtdorf teaches priesthood holders that they are bearers of God’s light, which can bring spiritual healing to those in darkness.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: The Lord Leads His Church
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches us that the Lord leads His Church through prophets and that we need to have faith to sustain those called to lead in the Church.

talks.author: Jean B. Bingham
talks.title: That Your Joy Might Be Full
talks.synopsis: Sister Bingham teaches that, despite the difficulties of mortal life, we can turn to Jesus Christ as the source of all healing, peace, and eternal progress.

talks.author: Donald L. Hallstrom
talks.title: Has the Day of Miracles Ceased?
talks.synopsis: Elder Hallstrom teaches about different kinds of miracles and testifies of the spiritual miracles that we can all receive through the gospel.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: Exceeding Great and Precious Promises
talks.synopsis: Elder Bednar teaches about focusing on the promises of the gospel and how the Sabbath day, the temple, and our homes can help us remember these promises.

talks.author: W. Christopher Waddell
talks.title: Turn to the Lord
talks.synopsis: Bishop Waddell teaches that despite the challenges that life brings to us all, we can choose to turn to the Savior, receive His help, and live rewarding lives.

talks.author: W. Craig Zwick
talks.title: Lord, Wilt Thou Cause That My Eyes May Be Opened
talks.synopsis: Elder Zwick teaches us how focusing on Jesus Christ can help us to look beyond what we literally see so that we can regard others as He sees them.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Fear Not to Do Good
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches that as we study the Book of Mormon, increase our faith in Jesus Christ, we will overcome fear and have a desire to help those in need.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: The Trek Continues!
talks.synopsis: Elder Ballard teaches us that while we remember the Mormon pioneer trek, we must also trek through our lives with faith in God and compassion for others.

talks.author: Tad R. Callister
talks.title: God’s Compelling Witness: The Book of Mormon
talks.synopsis: Brother Callister describes how critics of the Church try but fail to disprove the Book of Mormon. He testifies that Joseph Smith translated it by revelation.

talks.author: Joni L. Koch
talks.title: Apart, but Still One
talks.synopsis: Elder Koch teaches about the importance of being united with our Church leaders and fellow members.

talks.author: Stanley G. Ellis
talks.title: Do We Trust Him? Hard Is Good
talks.synopsis: Elder Ellis teaches that the Lord trust us. Do we have the faith to trust Him? Hard experiences can make us stronger and more humble.

talks.author: Adilson de Paula Parrella
talks.title: Essential Truths—Our Need to Act
talks.synopsis: Elder Parrella reminds us that the First Vision and the Prophet Joseph Smith brought forth truths that are essential to our happiness and exaltation.

talks.author: Ian S. Ardern
talks.title: Seek Ye Out of the Best Books
talks.synopsis: Elder Ardern teaches how fortifying our testimonies of Jesus Christ and the Book of Mormon can help increase our faith as we face opposition and questions.

talks.author: José L. Alonso
talks.title: Love One Another as He Has Loved Us
talks.synopsis: Elder Alonso teaches us how we can follow the Savior’s example of love by serving and forgiving others.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: The Voice of the Lord
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen testifies that the Lord’s prophets and apostles speak for Him, and he invites us to listen to and follow their counsel.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Solemn Assembly
talks.synopsis: In a solemn assembly, President Eyring presents the names of the First Presidency and Quorum of the Twelve Apostles for sustaining votes.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Precious Gifts from God
talks.synopsis: President Ballard teaches that exercising faith in Jesus Christ and recognizing the precious gifts from God in our lives brings joy to ourselves and others.

talks.author: Brian K. Taylor
talks.title: Am I a Child of God?
talks.synopsis: Elder Taylor teaches how we can be strengthened through understanding our divine identity as children of God.

talks.author: Larry J. Echo Hawk
talks.title: Even as Christ Forgives You, So Also Do Ye
talks.synopsis: Elder Echo Hawk teaches the principle of forgiveness with the example of his family forgiving a young man following an accident that took his brother’s life.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: The Heart of a Prophet
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson explains the divine process of the calling and sustaining of a living prophet on the earth.

talks.author: Lynn G. Robbins
talks.title: Until Seventy Times Seven
talks.synopsis: Elder Robbins teaches that sins and mistakes are part of life and that through sincere repentance, we can continually access God’s forgiveness and help.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: The Prophet of God
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen teaches that there is safety and peace in following the prophet, whose most important role is to point the way to the Savior.

talks.author: Kevin R. Jergensen
talks.title: Church Auditing Department Report, 2017
talks.synopsis: Kevin R. Jergensen, managing director of the Church Auditing Department, presents the auditing report for 2017.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: Meek and Lowly of Heart
talks.synopsis: Sharing examples of meekness from the scriptures and the lives of modern-day prophets, Elder Bednar teaches that this Christlike attribute can be developed.

talks.author: Taylor G. Godoy
talks.title: One More Day
talks.synopsis: Elder Godoy teaches about the blessings that come through sacrifice.

talks.author: Bonnie L. Oscarson
talks.title: Young Women in the Work
talks.synopsis: Sister Oscarson outlines ways the young women of the Church can contribute to their wards and branches.

talks.author: Taniela B. Wakolo
talks.title: Saving Ordinances Will Bring Us Marvelous Light
talks.synopsis: Elder Wakolo discusses the role of ordinances, covenants, and Jesus Christ‘s Atonement in receiving the power of godliness in our lives.

talks.author: Devin G. Durrant
talks.title: Teaching in the Home—a Joyful and Sacred Responsibility
talks.synopsis: Brother Durrant talks about the sacred parental responsibility of teaching children and describes different kinds of teaching opportunities.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: Family History and Temple Work: Sealing and Healing
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund teaches that when we do family history and temple work for our ancestors, God bestows blessings on both sides of the veil.

talks.author: Douglas D. Holmes
talks.title: What Every Aaronic Priesthood Holder Needs to Understand
talks.synopsis: Brother Holmes teaches that Aaronic Priesthood holders have an important role in helping others to receive the Savior’s atoning power in their lives.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Introductory Remarks
talks.synopsis: President Nelson announces that high priests and elders, at the ward level, will be combined into one elders quorum.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: The Elders Quorum
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson explains the purposes for combining elders and high priests into one elders quorum at the ward level and gives details about this change.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: Behold! A Royal Army
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband shares clarifying details about changes to the organization of Melchizedek Priesthood quorums and discusses the blessings of these changes.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Inspired Ministering
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches that ministering to others in the Lord’s way requires feeling love for each other and following the promptings of the Spirit.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: The Powers of the Priesthood
talks.synopsis: President Oaks shares principles governing the exercise of the Melchizedek Priesthood in the Church and in the home.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Ministering with the Power and Authority of God
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches that we should minister to one another in Christ’s name, with His power and authority, and with His loving kindness.

talks.author: Larry Y. Wilson
talks.title: Take the Holy Spirit as Your Guide
talks.synopsis: Elder Wilson teaches principles that lead to receiving personal revelation from the Lord through the Holy Ghost.

talks.author: Reyna I. Aburto
talks.title: With One Accord
talks.synopsis: Sister Aburto teaches that to reach our divine destiny we need to follow Christ’s example of unity with His Father and be more unified with Them and each other.

talks.author: Massimo De Feo
talks.title: Pure Love: The True Sign of Every True Disciple of Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder De Feo teaches that the gospel is centered on pure love and that our discipleship is an expression of our love for God and one another.

talks.author: Claudio D. Zivic
talks.title: He That Shall Endure unto the End, the Same Shall Be Saved
talks.synopsis: Elder Zivic teaches the importance of enduring to the end in faith, repentance, and obedience.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: His Spirit to Be with You
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches about receiving the Holy Ghost, using New Testament scriptures and Joseph Smith as examples.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Small and Simple Things
talks.synopsis: President Oaks reminds us that small and simple things, including our small, daily positive or negative choices, over time bring about great things.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Revelation for the Church, Revelation for Our Lives
talks.synopsis: President Nelson testifies that the Lord leads the Church through revelation and that personal revelation is available to everyone.

talks.author: Gerrit W. Gong
talks.title: Christ the Lord Is Risen Today
talks.synopsis: Elder Gong shares his powerful witness of the resurrected Savior, Jesus Christ, and of His modern-day prophets.

talks.author: Ulisses Soares
talks.title: Prophets Speak by the Power of the Holy Spirit
talks.synopsis: Elder Soares testifies that prophets are led by the Holy Spirit and teach of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Ministering
talks.synopsis: President Nelson introduces a newer, holier approach to caring for and ministering to others.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: “Be With and Strengthen Them”
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland teaches that we should be motivated by the pure love of Christ as we become more committed to caring for and ministering to others.

talks.author: Jean B. Bingham
talks.title: Ministering as the Savior Does
talks.synopsis: Sister Bingham teaches about ministering to each other and gives examples of how we can follow the Savior’s example of loving service through simple acts.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Behold the Man!
talks.synopsis: Elder Uchtdorf testifies that the greatest day in history was when the Savior overcame sin and death. We can find joy and peace as we see Him for who He is.

talks.author: Gérald Caussé
talks.title: It Is All about People
talks.synopsis: Bishop Caussé teaches that the Church’s strength comes from the daily actions of millions of Christ’s disciples who strive each day to follow His example.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: Prepare to Meet God
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook teaches that we prepare to meet God by fulfilling divinely given responsibilities in missionary work, temple work, and strengthening Church members.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Let Us All Press On
talks.synopsis: President Nelson encourages us to study the messages of this historic general conference. He announces the construction of seven new temples.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Opening Remarks
talks.synopsis: President Nelson announces that it is time for a home-centered Church, reflected in organizational adjustments that will strengthen individuals and families.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: Deep and Lasting Conversion to Heavenly Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook announces adjustments to the Sunday meeting schedule and new curriculum, both of which are intended to balance gospel learning at home and at church.

talks.author: M. Joseph Brough
talks.title: Lift Up Your Head and Rejoice
talks.synopsis: Brother Brough teaches that we can find joy even amid trials as we face hard things in the Lord’s way.

talks.author: Steven R. Bangerter
talks.title: Laying the Foundation of a Great Work
talks.synopsis: Elder Bangerter teaches us how we lay a gospel foundation in our families by teaching our children the gospel and establishing righteous traditions.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: Be Not Troubled
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband reminds us that despite the perilous times we live in, we do not need to fear if we keep focused on our faith in Jesus Christ.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: Gather Together in One All Things in Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Bednar teaches that as we link various gospel principles and practices together in Christ, we gain perspective and increased spiritual capacity.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Truth and the Plan
talks.synopsis: President Oaks teaches that we should seek truth from trustworthy sources and shares some fundamental truths that explain why Latter-day Saints live as we do.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: Firm and Steadfast in the Faith of Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson teaches that we can become firm and steadfast in the faith by making the gospel the defining focus of our lives.

talks.author: Dean M. Davies
talks.title: Come, Listen to a Prophet’s Voice
talks.synopsis: Bishop Dean M. Davies teaches about the role of a prophet and essential elements of a testimony, including the Book of Mormon and faith in Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Ulisses Soares
talks.title: One in Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Soares teaches how we can better encourage, help, and support recent converts and those who are interested in the Church.

talks.author: Gerrit W. Gong
talks.title: Our Campfire of Faith
talks.synopsis: Elder Gong teaches about creativity, faith, and ministering and how our efforts in these areas can enrich and encourage us.

talks.author: Paul B. Pieper
talks.title: All Must Take upon Them the Name Given of the Father
talks.synopsis: Elder Pieper teaches what it means to take upon us the name of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Believe, Love, Do
talks.synopsis: Elder Uchtdorf teaches that the Church is a place of growth where our belief in God, our love for Him and others, and our obedience bring meaning and happiness.

talks.author: Joy D. Jones
talks.title: For Him
talks.synopsis: Sister Jones teaches how we can serve others by loving and serving Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Michelle D. Craig
talks.title: Divine Discontent
talks.synopsis: Sister Craig encourages sisters to welcome feelings of discontent that inspire them to improve—to act in faith, to do good, and to rely on Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Cristina B. Franco
talks.title: The Joy of Unselfish Service
talks.synopsis: Sister Franco teaches that we should follow the Savior’s example of service, sacrifice, and love.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Women and Gospel Learning in the Home
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches that we can look to the Savior as our perfect example as we strive to emphasize gospel learning in our homes.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Parents and Children
talks.synopsis: President Oaks encourages women in shepherding God’s children along the covenant path and counsels young women to limit cell phone usage and be kind to others.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Sisters’ Participation in the Gathering of Israel
talks.synopsis: President Nelson testifies of the great influence of women and the spiritual gifts they have. He invites them to use their gifts to help gather Israel.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: The Vision of the Redemption of the Dead
talks.synopsis: President Ballard describes personal events in Joseph F. Smith’s life that put the revelation on the redemption of the dead contained in D&C 138 into context.

talks.author: Bonnie H. Cordon
talks.title: Becoming a Shepherd
talks.synopsis: Sister Cordon teaches that ministering to the Lord’s sheep entails knowing and numbering them, watching over them, and gathering them into the fold of God.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: The Ministry of Reconciliation
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland encourages us to be forgiving and to labor with the Savior as peacemakers, that we might be reconciled with God and with each other.

talks.author: Shayne M. Bowen
talks.title: The Role of the Book of Mormon in Conversion
talks.synopsis: Elder Bowens testifies of the converting power of the Book of Mormon and how it is the means by which we can gather Israel in the last days.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: Wounded
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen encourages those who suffer from physical or spiritual wounds to increase their faith in Jesus Christ and seek His healing power.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: The Correct Name of the Church
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches us to call the Church by its correct name, The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Try, Try, Try
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches us that the Savior will carry us through our trials and we will take His name upon us as we pray for His love and share it with others.

talks.author: Brian K. Ashton
talks.title: The Father
talks.synopsis: Brother Ashton teaches key doctrinal points about Heavenly Father to help us better understand His true character and exercise faith in Him and His Son.

talks.author: Robert C. Gay
talks.title: Taking upon Ourselves the Name of Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Gay teaches that we can take upon ourselves the name of Christ by seeing as He sees, serving as He served, and trusting that His grace is sufficient.

talks.author: Matthew L. Carpenter
talks.title: Wilt Thou Be Made Whole?
talks.synopsis: Elder Carpenter teaches that the Savior can heal us physically and spiritually.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: Choose You This Day
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund teaches that eternal happiness will come as we choose to follow God’s plan and join Him in His work.

talks.author: Jack N. Gerard
talks.title: Now Is the Time
talks.synopsis: Elder Gerard teaches the importance of separating ourselves from the world and reflecting on the truths of the gospel.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: Shepherding Souls
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson teaches that we have a responsibility to minister to others, shepherding them toward the temple and ultimately to the Savior.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Becoming Exemplary Latter-day Saints
talks.synopsis: President Nelson announces 12 new temples. He also encourages us to study the conference messages and apply them in our lives.

talks.author: Ulisses Soares
talks.title: How Can I Understand?
talks.synopsis: Elder Soares explains that we all have a mandate to learn the gospel and teach it to our family and others.

talks.author: Rebecca L. Craven
talks.title: Careful versus Casual
talks.synopsis: Sister Craven teaches the importance of being careful rather than casual in our discipleship.

talks.author: Brook P. Hales
talks.title: Answers to Prayer
talks.synopsis: Elder Hales shares three accounts to illustrate different ways Heavenly Father answers prayer.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Missionary Work: Sharing What Is in Your Heart
talks.synopsis: Elder Uchtdorf gives five suggestions for how to participate in missionary work.

talks.author: W. Christopher Waddell
talks.title: Just as He Did
talks.synopsis: Bishop Waddell talks about the importance of following the example of the Savior as we minister to the needs of others.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: A Home Where the Spirit of the Lord Dwells
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches about creating a home that invites the Spirit of the Lord.

talks.author: Kevin R. Jergensen
talks.title: Church Auditing Department Report, 2018
talks.synopsis: Brother Jergensen presents the auditing report for 2018.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: The True, Pure, and Simple Gospel of Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: President Ballard teaches that joy comes from living the gospel simply, by keeping the two great commandments. The Sabbath and ministering are key ways to keep those commandments.

talks.author: Mathias Held
talks.title: Seeking Knowledge by the Spirit
talks.synopsis: Elder Held teaches us why we need to learn to discern the truth through the inspiration of the Holy Ghost rather than relying only on logical reasoning.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: The Eye of Faith
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen teaches that we can know truth through the scriptures, our personal prayers, our own experiences, the counsel of the living prophets and apostles, and the guidance of the Holy Ghost.

talks.author: Takashi Wada
talks.title: Feasting upon the Words of Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Wada talks about the blessings that come to us as we feast upon the words of Christ.

talks.author: David P. Homer
talks.title: Hearing His Voice
talks.synopsis: Elder Homer teaches the importance of identifying and listening to God’s voice.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: Behold the Lamb of God
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland teaches that sacrament meeting is the most sacred hour of our week, and he explains how to make the ordinance of the sacrament meaningful in our lives.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: Your Priesthood Playbook
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson teaches that we must make a personal plan so that when we face temptations, we will know what to do.

talks.author: Carl B. Cook
talks.title: The Quorum: A Place of Belonging
talks.synopsis: Elder Carl B. Cook shares the story of how a branch in Botswana grew thanks to a group of young priesthood holders and invites other priesthood holders to be united with the Lord in their priesthood quorums.

talks.author: Kim B. Clark
talks.title: Look unto Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Clark teaches that we need to look to Jesus Christ just as He looked to the Father. As we do so, the Savior will help us live our covenants and magnify our callings as elders in Israel.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Where Will This Lead?
talks.synopsis: President Oaks explains that we can make better choices by looking at the alternatives and pondering where they will lead.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: We Can Do Better and Be Better
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches about repentance and invites priesthood holders to repent so they can exercise priesthood power more fully.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: Abound with Blessings
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund teaches that Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ desire to bless us but that we must have faith in Christ and take action to obey the laws upon which the blessings are predicated.

talks.author: Sharon Eubank
talks.title: Christ: The Light That Shines in Darkness
talks.synopsis: Sister Eubank teaches that if we make Christ the center of our lives, He will support us in our trials and be our light in the darkness.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: Great Love for Our Father’s Children
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook teaches about the role of charity in sharing the gospel, temple and family history work, and home-centered gospel teaching.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: Preparing for the Lord’s Return
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson describes how Latter-day Saints prepare the earth for the Second Coming of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Tad R. Callister
talks.title: The Atonement of Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: Brother Callister teaches us how the Atonement of Jesus Christ helps us overcome the obstacles to our progress.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: “Come, Follow Me”
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches that we must make covenants with God in order to be exalted with our families.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Cleansed by Repentance
talks.synopsis: President Oaks teaches that Jesus Christ’s Atonement makes repentance and forgiveness possible for all if they follow the conditions prescribed by the Savior.

talks.author: Juan Pablo Villar
talks.title: Exercising Our Spiritual Muscles
talks.synopsis: Elder Villar teaches that we must act on our faith in Jesus Christ and not just read and learn about faith.

talks.author: Gerrit W. Gong
talks.title: Good Shepherd, Lamb of God
talks.synopsis: Elder Gong teaches that Jesus is the Good Shepherd, who calls us, gathers us, and teaches us to minister.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: Prepared to Obtain Every Needful Thing
talks.synopsis: Elder Bednar discusses implications of the new home-centered, Church-supported approach to learning.

talks.author: Kyle S. McKay
talks.title: The Immediate Goodness of God
talks.synopsis: Elder McKay testifies of the immediate blessings that come to those who call upon the Lord.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: Build a Fortress of Spirituality and Protection
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband teaches that when we build a fortress of spiritual strength, we can shun the advances of the adversary.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Closing Remarks
talks.synopsis: President Nelson closes the conference, announces new temples, and encourages us to be true disciples of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: The Message, the Meaning, and the Multitude
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland reminds us to always keep our focus on the Savior as the center of our lives, our faith, and our service.

talks.author: Terence M. Vinson
talks.title: True Disciples of the Savior
talks.synopsis: Elder Vinson teaches about the importance of committing to being a disciple of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Stephen W. Owen
talks.title: Be Faithful, Not Faithless
talks.synopsis: Brother Owen teaches how we can be spiritually nourished by home-centered, Church-supported gospel learning and living.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: The Joy of the Saints
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson teaches about the joy that comes from keeping the commandments, from overcoming challenges, and from serving as Jesus served.

talks.author: Michelle D. Craig
talks.title: Spiritual Capacity
talks.synopsis: Sister Craig teaches how we can increase our spiritual capacity to receive revelation.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: Unwavering Commitment to Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund teaches that God invites us to cast our old ways completely out of reach and begin a new life in Christ, showing our commitment by making and keeping covenants.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Trust in the Lord
talks.synopsis: President Oaks teaches that trusting in the Lord is the best option when we have questions about things that have not yet been revealed.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: Watchful unto Prayer Continually
talks.synopsis: Using cheetahs as an example of predators, Elder Bednar teaches three ways to be aware of the devil’s tactics.

talks.author: Rubén V. Alliaud
talks.title: Found through the Power of the Book of Mormon
talks.synopsis: Elder Alliaud teaches how conversion can occur through the powerful truths in the Book of Mormon.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Witnesses, Aaronic Priesthood Quorums, and Young Women Classes
talks.synopsis: President Nelson announces policy changes regarding witnesses and adjustments to Aaronic Priesthood quorums and Young Women classes.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: Adjustments to Strengthen Youth
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook announces organizational changes intended to help bishoprics focus on their responsibility to care for the youth.

talks.author: Mark L. Pace
talks.title: Come, Follow Me—the Lord’s Counterstrategy and Proactive Plan
talks.synopsis: President Pace teaches that studying Come, Follow Me combats the attacks of the adversary and brings members closer to God and their families.

talks.author: L. Todd Budge
talks.title: Consistent and Resilient Trust
talks.synopsis: Elder Budge teaches about trusting in the Lord as he compares the Jaredites’ journey to our journey through mortality.

talks.author: Jorge M. Alvarado
talks.title: After the Trial of Our Faith
talks.synopsis: Elder Alvarado shares examples of those who witnessed miracles after the trial of their faith.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: Standing by Our Promises and Covenants
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband reminds us of how important it is that we keep the covenants and promises that we make to the Lord and others.

talks.author: Reyna I. Aburto
talks.title: Thru Cloud and Sunshine, Lord, Abide with Me!
talks.synopsis: Sister Aburto testifies that the Savior can help all of God’s children endure mental and physical infirmities.

talks.author: Lisa L. Harkness
talks.title: Honoring His Name
talks.synopsis: Sister Harkness teaches what it means to take upon ourselves the name of Jesus Christ and always remember Him.

talks.author: Bonnie H. Cordon
talks.title: Beloved Daughters
talks.synopsis: Sister Cordon announces adjustments to the Young Women organization and teaches that the changes will help young women draw closer to the Savior.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Covenant Women in Partnership with God
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches how women who have made covenants partner with God to serve His children and thus prepare themselves to return to Him.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Two Great Commandments
talks.synopsis: President Oaks explains how the commandments to love God and love our neighbor relate to our interactions with those identifying as LGBT.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Spiritual Treasures
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches that women who have been endowed with priesthood power in the temple can access the power of God in their lives.

talks.author: Gerrit W. Gong
talks.title: Covenant Belonging
talks.synopsis: Elder Gong describes the blessings of entering into a covenant relationship with God and with each other.

talks.author: Cristina B. Franco
talks.title: Finding Joy in Sharing the Gospel
talks.synopsis: Sister Franco teaches the importance of sharing the gospel with those around us.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Your Great Adventure
talks.synopsis: Elder Uchtdorf teaches about our journey of discipleship and encourages us to seek God, minister to others, and share our experience with others.

talks.author: Walter F. González
talks.title: The Savior’s Touch
talks.synopsis: Elder González teaches us that the Savior wants to heal us and that if we come to Him and seek His will, He will either heal us or give us strength to endure.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: Deceive Me Not
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson warns us of the cunning and deception of the adversary and invites us to stand strong and follow the Lord’s commands.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: The Second Great Commandment
talks.synopsis: President Nelson gives examples of how the Church and its members are fulfilling the Lord’s second great commandment to love our neighbors through humanitarian efforts.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Holiness and the Plan of Happiness
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches that greater happiness comes through greater personal holiness, obtained by faith in Jesus Christ, repentance, and facing adversity.

talks.author: Hans T. Boom
talks.title: Knowing, Loving, and Growing
talks.synopsis: Elder Boom teaches us that each of us can grow in our role in God’s work by coming to know who we are and then ministering to others in Christlike love.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Giving Our Spirits Control over Our Bodies
talks.synopsis: President Ballard teaches that living right involves overcoming the natural man and giving priority to our spiritual nature.

talks.author: Peter M. Johnson
talks.title: Power to Overcome the Adversary
talks.synopsis: Elder Johnson teaches that we can overcome Satan’s deceptions, distractions, and discouragement through praying, studying the Book of Mormon, and partaking of the sacrament.

talks.author: Ulisses Soares
talks.title: Take Up Our Cross
talks.synopsis: Elder Soares invites us to take up our cross by following the Savior’s perfect example and by following his teachings and commandments.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: Fruit
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen teaches that as we focus on Jesus Christ and faithfully endure opposition, the fruit of the tree of life (the blessings of the Atonement) can be ours.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Closing Remarks
talks.synopsis: President Nelson encourages members to become more holy, to prepare for next general conference, and to study the Book of Mormon.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Opening Message
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches that as we strive to become more like our Savior, we can have peace and joy even in difficult times.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Shall We Not Go On in So Great a Cause?
talks.synopsis: President Ballard describes the faithfulness and sacrifice of Joseph Smith and his brother Hyrum.

talks.author: James R. Rasband
talks.title: Ensuring a Righteous Judgment
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband teaches how the Atonement of Christ fulfills both justice and mercy.

talks.author: Joy D. Jones
talks.title: An Especially Noble Calling
talks.synopsis: Sister Jones draws on the example and teachings of Joseph Smith to encourage women in striving to fulfill their great spiritual potential.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: Spiritually Defining Memories
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen teaches that remembering the spiritually defining moments in our lives can strength and comfort us during challenging times.

talks.author: Douglas D. Holmes
talks.title: Deep in Our Heart
talks.synopsis: Brother Holmes teaches us to focus on relationships, revelation, agency, repentance, and sacrifice so the gospel will sink deeper in our hearts.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Prayers of Faith
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches how praying in faith can help us each discover our unique role in the ongoing Restoration.

talks.author: Kevin R. Jergensen
talks.title: Church Auditing Department Report, 2019
talks.synopsis: Kevin Jergensen presents the Church Auditing Department report for 2019.

talks.author: Ulisses Soares
talks.title: The Coming Forth of the Book of Mormon
talks.synopsis: Elder Soares describes the many miracles involved in the coming forth of the Book of Mormon, including the miracles that can happen in our lives because of this sacred record.

talks.author: John A. McCune
talks.title: Come unto Christ—Living as Latter-day Saints
talks.synopsis: Elder McCune teaches us how the restored gospel of Jesus Christ helps us to do difficult things and help others do the same.

talks.author: Gérald Caussé
talks.title: A Living Witness of the Living Christ
talks.synopsis: Bishop Caussé teaches that the Book of Mormon restores the true knowledge of Jesus Christ and His Atonement.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: Consider the Goodness and Greatness of God
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund invites us to remember the goodness and greatness of Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ and identifies various blessings from doing so.

talks.author: Benjamin M. Z. Tai
talks.title: The Power of the Book of Mormon in Conversion
talks.synopsis: Elder Tai teaches that the Book of Mormon contains the doctrine of Christ and helps us draw nearer to God.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: A Good Foundation against the Time to Come
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson teaches how the improvements to the Salt Lake Temple can help inspire us to build strong personal foundations.

talks.author: Gerrit W. Gong
talks.title: Hosanna and Hallelujah—The Living Jesus Christ: The Heart of Restoration and Easter
talks.synopsis: Elder Gong teaches how Jesus Christ is the heart of Easter and latter-day restoration.

talks.author: Laudy Ruth Kaouk Alvarez
talks.title: How the Priesthood Blesses Youth
talks.synopsis: Sister Kaouk teaches how young people can be blessed by the priesthood.

talks.author: Enzo Serge Petelo
talks.title: How the Priesthood Blesses Youth
talks.synopsis: Brother Petelo teaches how priesthood service can bless young men.

talks.author: Jean B. Bingham
talks.title: United in Accomplishing God’s Work
talks.synopsis: Sister Bingham teaches how, following Adam and Eve’s example, men and women can work together to value each other’s innate differences and divine roles.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: He Goes before Us
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches that the Lord knows the future and leads us, step by step, to accomplish his purposes in the latter days.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: The Melchizedek Priesthood and the Keys
talks.synopsis: President Oaks teaches about the functioning of the priesthood in the Church and in the home.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Opening the Heavens for Help
talks.synopsis: President Nelson introduces a new visual identifier for the Church and invites all to join in fasting and prayer.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: Fulfillment of Prophecy
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband teaches about the prophecies that have been fulfilled during the ongoing Restoration of the Church.

talks.author: Bonnie H. Cordon
talks.title: That They May See
talks.synopsis: Sister Cordon invites us to follow the example of Jesus Christ and to in turn be a light and an example to those around us.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: A Perfect Brightness of Hope
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland teaches that the Restoration of the gospel shows that we can have hope because God is with us.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: “Let This House Be Built unto My Name”
talks.synopsis: Elder Bednar teaches that temple ordinances and covenants change our hearts and bless families on both sides of the veil.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Hear Him
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches how we can hear the Lord, and he issues a new proclamation: “The Restoration of the Fulness of the Gospel of Jesus Christ: A Bicentennial Proclamation to the World.”

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Hosanna Shout
talks.synopsis: President Nelson leads participants in the sacred Hosanna Shout in commemoration of the First Vision of the Father and the Son.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: The Great Plan
talks.synopsis: President Oaks teaches the principal elements of Heavenly Father’s plan, including four assurances it gives us to help us through mortality.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: The Blessing of Continuing Revelation to Prophets and Personal Revelation to Guide Our Lives
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook teaches that prophets continue to receive revelation to guide the Church and that we can receive revelation to guide our lives.

talks.author: Ricardo P. Giménez
talks.title: Finding Refuge from the Storms of Life
talks.synopsis: Elder Giménez teaches that Jesus Christ can be the refuge from the adversity and storms in our life if we let Him.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Come and Belong
talks.synopsis: Elder Uchtdorf invites all to join us in ministering to God’s children, following in the footsteps of the Savior, and making this world a better place.

talks.author: L. Whitney Clayton
talks.title: The Finest Homes
talks.synopsis: Elder Clayton teaches that we become our best selves as we strive to live the restored gospel of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: Sharing the Message of the Restoration and the Resurrection
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson teaches about the importance of sharing the message of the Restoration and offers three requirements to do so successfully.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Go Forward in Faith
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches that we will be strengthened as we are valiant followers of Jesus Christ and as we honor our covenants. He announces new temples.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Moving Forward
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches that despite adversity, the work of the Lord is moving forward and we can use this time to grow spiritually.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: We Will Prove Them Herewith
talks.synopsis: Elder Bednar teaches that if we prepare and press forward with faith in Jesus Christ, we will be able to overcome adversity.

talks.author: Scott D. Whiting
talks.title: Becoming like Him
talks.synopsis: Elder Whiting teaches how we can follow the commandment to become more like our Savior, Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Michelle D. Craig
talks.title: Eyes to See
talks.synopsis: Sister Craig teaches that with the help of the Holy Ghost we can learn to see others and see ourselves as the Savior does.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: Hearts Knit in Righteousness and Unity
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook encourages members to be a Zion people and dwell in righteousness, becoming an oasis of unity while celebrating diversity.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: Recommended to the Lord
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband encourages us to strive to be “recommended to the Lord” by always following the Savior and being worthy of a temple recommend.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Love Your Enemies
talks.synopsis: President Oaks teaches that, with the Savior’s help, it is possible to obey and seek to improve our nation’s laws and also to love our adversaries and our enemies.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: Sustainable Societies
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson teaches that the truth of God points a way to personal happiness and community well-being now and to peace and joy hereafter.

talks.author: Steven J. Lund
talks.title: Finding Joy in Christ
talks.synopsis: Brother Lund teaches that young people can find joy in Christ by helping others along the covenant path through the Children and Youth program.

talks.author: Gerrit W. Gong
talks.title: All Nations, Kindreds, and Tongues
talks.synopsis: Elder Gong describes how God’s promises to bless all nations are being fulfilled, in small and simple ways, throughout the world.

talks.author: W. Christopher Waddell
talks.title: There Was Bread
talks.synopsis: Bishop Waddell teaches that we should seek inspiration and rely on gospel principles to become more self-reliant.

talks.author: Matthew S. Holland
talks.title: The Exquisite Gift of the Son
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland describes how the suffering and Atonement of Jesus Christ can turn the misery of sin and adversity into joy.

talks.author: William K. Jackson
talks.title: The Culture of Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Jackson teaches that we can all celebrate our individual earthly cultures while being part of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: God Will Do Something Unimaginable
talks.synopsis: Elder Uchtdorf teaches that as we endure our trials, God’s love and the blessings of the gospel will help us move forward and upward to heights unimagined.

talks.author: Sharon Eubank
talks.title: By Union of Feeling We Obtain Power with God
talks.synopsis: Sister Eubank teaches us how we can achieve greater unity with each other and thus obtain greater power from God.

talks.author: Rebecca L. Craven
talks.title: Keep the Change
talks.synopsis: Sister Craven teaches that through Jesus Christ, we can make lasting changes and become more like Him.

talks.author: Cristina B. Franco
talks.title: The Healing Power of Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: Sister Franco teaches that through the Atonement of Jesus Christ, we can all be mended and healed.

talks.author: Video: The Light That Shineth in Darkness
talks.title: A gentle video montage of women around the world engaging in varied circumstances of service, challenge, and connection.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Sisters in Zion
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches that women will be key to the gathering of Israel and the creation of a Zion people who will dwell in peace in the New Jerusalem.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Be of Good Cheer
talks.synopsis: President Oaks teaches that because of the gospel we can be of good cheer, even in the midst of challenges and adversity.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Embrace the Future with Faith
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches that we should prepare temporally, spiritually, and emotionally for the future.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Watch Ye Therefore, and Pray Always
talks.synopsis: President Ballard teaches us to pray for safety and peace for our nations, families, and Church leaders.

talks.author: Lisa L. Harkness
talks.title: Peace, Be Still
talks.synopsis: Sister Harkness teaches that just as the Savior calmed the storm on the Sea of Galilee, He can help us find strength and peace in the midst of trials.

talks.author: Ulisses Soares
talks.title: Seek Christ in Every Thought
talks.synopsis: Elder Soares teaches that keeping our thoughts and desires virtuous helps us resist temptation.

talks.author: Carlos A. Godoy
talks.title: I Believe in Angels
talks.synopsis: Elder Godoy teaches that the Lord is aware of our needs and He will send angels to help us.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: We Talk of Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen encourages us to learn more about the Savior and talk about Him at home, at church, on social media, and in our everyday conversations.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Let God Prevail
talks.synopsis: President Nelson describes latter-day covenant Israel as those who let God prevail in their lives. He invites us to make God our life’s most important influence.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Tested, Proved, and Polished
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches that enduring the trials of mortal life faithfully helps us to become more like Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Jeremy R. Jaggi
talks.title: Let Patience Have Her Perfect Work, and Count It All Joy!
talks.synopsis: Elder Jaggi explains how we can find joy, even during times of adversity, by exercising patience and faith in Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: Highly Favored of the Lord
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson teaches that although we will face disappointment and affliction, we can come to know that we are highly favored of the Lord.

talks.author: Milton Camargo
talks.title: Ask, Seek, and Knock
talks.synopsis: Brother Camargo teaches how to ask, seek, and knock in prayer.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: Do Justly, Love Mercy, and Walk Humbly with God
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund explains how following the counsel in Micah 6:8 can help us stay on the covenant path and become more like Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Kelly R. Johnson
talks.title: Enduring Power
talks.synopsis: Elder Johnson teaches that we can access the power of God by building our faith and keeping our covenants.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: Waiting on the Lord
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland teaches that we can have faith that the Lord will answer our prayers in His time and His way.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: A New Normal
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches us to turn our hearts to Heavenly Father and the Savior to achieve our divine potential and feel peace. He announces six new temples.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Welcome Message
talks.synopsis: President Nelson welcomes us to general conference, notes how the Lord is hastening His work, and invites us to remove debris from our lives so that we can be more worthy.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: God among Us
talks.synopsis: Elder Uchtdorf teaches us to have hope, not be discouraged, and see the ways in which God is among us.

talks.author: Joy D. Jones
talks.title: Essential Conversations
talks.synopsis: Sister Jones reiterates the importance of teaching the gospel of Jesus Christ to our children.

talks.author: Jan E. Newman
talks.title: Teaching in the Savior’s Way
talks.synopsis: Brother Newman reiterates the importances of teaching like the Savior in the Church and in our homes.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: Hearts Knit Together
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson teaches the importance of kindness, love, and respect, offering specific counsel to children, youth, and adults.

talks.author: Gerrit W. Gong
talks.title: Room in the Inn
talks.synopsis: Elder Gong teaches that the Savior invites us to be good Samaritans who welcome all to His Inn (meaning His Church), where they can find refuge.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: I Love to See the Temple
talks.synopsis: President Eyring testifies of the spiritual blessings that come to those who serve in the temple.

talks.author: Jared B. Larson
talks.title: Church Auditing Department Report, 2020
talks.synopsis: Jared B. Larson presents the Church Auditing Department report for 2020.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: Not as the World Giveth
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland teaches that we can find peace in Christ, even in the midst of conflict and contention.

talks.author: Jorge T. Becerra
talks.title: Poor Little Ones
talks.synopsis: Elder Becerra teaches the importance of caring for one another and recognizing that we are all needed in the kingdom of God.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: Infuriating Unfairness
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund teaches that we should not let unfairness make us bitter or corrode our faith but should ask God for help and increase our reliance on the Savior.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: The Personal Journey of a Child of God
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen teaches that God’s spirit children come to earth on their own personal journeys and that we should welcome them, safeguard them, and love them.

talks.author: Thierry K. Mutombo
talks.title: Ye Shall Be Free
talks.synopsis: Elder Mutombo teaches that Jesus Christ is the Light of the World and that He can guide us in dark and troubling times.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Hope in Christ
talks.synopsis: President Ballard shares five key principles that can help anyone who is lonely, including those who are single, find hope in Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: Bishops—Shepherds over the Lord’s Flock
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook teaches about how bishops care for members of the rising generation in their wards.

talks.author: Ahmad S. Corbitt
talks.title: You Can Gather Israel!
talks.synopsis: Brother Corbitt teaches that the youth of the Church can help gather Israel as they understand their true identity and unique power.

talks.author: S. Gifford Nielsen
talks.title: This Is Our Time!
talks.synopsis: Elder Nielsen reminds us that we can take courage in the thought that we have been sent here by Heavenly Father at this decisive time in history in order to fulfill His purposes.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: Bless in His Name
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches priesthood holders that the purpose for their receiving the priesthood is to bless people on the Lord’s behalf and in His name, magnifying their callings with love and diligence.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: What Has Our Savior Done for Us?
talks.synopsis: President Oaks teaches that Jesus Christ made it possible for each of us to return to our Heavenly Father and achieve our eternal destiny.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: What We Are Learning and Will Never Forget
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches four lessons he hopes we have learned through the pandemic.

talks.author: Ulisses Soares
talks.title: Jesus Christ: The Caregiver of Our Soul
talks.synopsis: Elder Soares teaches about Jesus Christ, His Atonement, and the gift of repentance.

talks.author: Reyna I. Aburto
talks.title: The Grave Has No Victory
talks.synopsis: Sister Aburto testifies of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ and that His Atonement helps us overcome sorrow and find hope.

talks.author: S. Mark Palmer
talks.title: Our Sorrow Shall Be Turned into Joy
talks.synopsis: Elder Palmer testifies of the Resurrection and shares how his parents joined the Church.

talks.author: Edward Dube
talks.title: Pressing toward the Mark
talks.synopsis: Elder Dube encourages us to focus on our goal of eternal life with God, no matter what challenges this life brings.

talks.author: José A. Teixeira
talks.title: Remember Your Way Back Home
talks.synopsis: Elder Teixeira teaches the importance of following the Savior as we work toward returning to our heavenly home.

talks.author: Taniela B. Wakolo
talks.title: God Loves His Children
talks.synopsis: Elder Wakolo testifies of God’s love and describes how He shows that love to His children.

talks.author: Chi Hong (Sam) Wong
talks.title: They Cannot Prevail; We Cannot Fall
talks.synopsis: Elder Wong teaches that we cannot fall if we build our foundation on Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Michael John U. Teh
talks.title: Our Personal Savior
talks.synopsis: Elder Teh teaches the importance of coming to know the Savior and appreciate His Atonement on a personal level.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Christ Is Risen; Faith in Him Will Move Mountains
talks.synopsis: President Nelson testifies of the power of faith in Jesus Christ to help us overcome life’s challenges. He suggests five ways to develop stronger faith.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: Defending Our Divinely Inspired Constitution
talks.synopsis: President Oaks describes the divinely inspired principles in the United States Constitution. He teaches how Latter-day Saints can defend these principles.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: “Behold! I Am a God of Miracles”
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband testifies that miracles continue to bless followers of Jesus Christ, according to our faith and God’s will.

talks.author: Timothy J. Dyches
talks.title: Light Cleaveth unto Light
talks.synopsis: Elder Dyches teaches that Jesus Christ is the Light of the World and the source of true happiness and peace.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: Why the Covenant Path
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson describes five elements of what it means to be on the covenant path and encourages us to heed the prophet’s call to stay on the path.

talks.author: Alan R. Walker
talks.title: The Gospel Light of Truth and Love
talks.synopsis: Elder Walker teaches that the work of God is progressing at an accelerated pace in the latter days.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: “The Principles of My Gospel”
talks.synopsis: Elder Bednar teaches that correct gospel principles help us make wise choices and stay on the covenant path.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: COVID-19 and Temples
talks.synopsis: President Nelson talks about the reopening of temples and announces plans to construct new temples.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Pure Truth, Pure Doctrine, and Pure Revelation
talks.synopsis: President Nelson welcomes people to conference and invites them to listen for pure truth, the pure doctrine of Christ, and pure revelation.

talks.author: Jeffrey R. Holland
talks.title: The Greatest Possession
talks.synopsis: Elder Holland teaches us to love God and follow Him completely.

talks.author: Bonnie H. Cordon
talks.title: Come unto Christ and Don’t Come Alone
talks.synopsis: Sister Cordon teaches that we are children of God and that our eternal purpose is to bring others to Christ.

talks.author: Ulisses Soares
talks.title: The Savior’s Abiding Compassion
talks.synopsis: Elder Soares teaches us that we should follow the Savior’s example of compassion for others by withholding judgment and having patience.

talks.author: D. Todd Christofferson
talks.title: The Love of God
talks.synopsis: Elder Christofferson teaches that the commandments represent God’s love for us and mark the path of healing, happiness, peace, and joy.

talks.author: Clark G. Gilbert
talks.title: Becoming More in Christ: The Parable of the Slope
talks.synopsis: Elder Gilbert teaches that regardless of our circumstances, the Lord can help us reach our ultimate potential.

talks.author: Patricio M. Giuffra
talks.title: A Faithful Search Rewarded
talks.synopsis: Elder Giuffra invites us to enjoy the blessings that come from having faith in Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Dallin H. Oaks
talks.title: The Need for a Church
talks.synopsis: President Oaks teaches the blessings of belonging to the Church of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: With the Power of God in Great Glory
talks.synopsis: Elder Bednar teaches that honoring our covenants helps us receive the power of godliness in our lives.

talks.author: Ciro Schmeil
talks.title: Faith to Act and Become
talks.synopsis: Elder Schmeil teaches that we can become better disciples of Jesus Christ as we ask, act, and study.

talks.author: Susan H. Porter
talks.title: God’s Love: The Most Joyous to the Soul
talks.synopsis: Sister Porter teaches that Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ have a pure love for each of us and that sharing Their love can bless us.

talks.author: Erich W. Kopischke
talks.title: Addressing Mental Health
talks.synopsis: Elder Kopischke shares some observations about mental illness, based on some of the trials his own family has gone through.

talks.author: Ronald A. Rasband
talks.title: The Things of My Soul
talks.synopsis: Elder Rasband shares seven “things of his soul”—precious principles that give purpose to his life as a disciple of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Christoffel Golden
talks.title: Preparing for the Second Coming of Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Golden teaches that we are getting closer to the Second Coming, a mournful day for the wicked but a day of peace for the righteous.

talks.author: Moisés Villanueva
talks.title: Favored of the Lord in All My Days
talks.synopsis: Elder Villanueva uses the examples of the Savior, Nephi, and a young missionary to show how we can face adversity with joy and compassion.

talks.author: Gary E. Stevenson
talks.title: Simply Beautiful—Beautifully Simple
talks.synopsis: Elder Stevenson uses stories from four Latter-day Saints to illustrate ways we can fulfill our divinely appointed responsibilities.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: “Lovest Thou Me More Than These?”
talks.synopsis: President Ballard teaches us how we can show that we love the Savior above all worldly things by believing in Him, serving Him, and serving others.

talks.author: Sharon Eubank
talks.title: I Pray He’ll Use Us
talks.synopsis: Sister Eubank reports on the Church’s recent humanitarian aid efforts.

talks.author: Brent H. Nielson
talks.title: Is There No Balm in Gilead?
talks.synopsis: Elder Nielson teaches that the Savior has the power to heal our hearts and sustain us through our trials as well as heal our bodies.

talks.author: Arnulfo Valenzuela
talks.title: Deepening Our Conversion to Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Valenzuela teaches that we can deepen our conversion as we study the scriptures and learn more about Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Bradley R. Wilcox
talks.title: Worthiness Is Not Flawlessness
talks.synopsis: Brother Wilcox teaches that we do not need to be perfect to have the grace and atoning power of Jesus Christ in our lives.

talks.author: Alfred Kyungu
talks.title: To Be a Follower of Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Kyungu teaches about four principles that can help us become better disciples of Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Marcus B. Nash
talks.title: Hold Up Your Light
talks.synopsis: Elder Nash teaches us to share the gospel in normal and natural ways so that we and those we share with can have joy and many other blessings.

talks.author: Henry B. Eyring
talks.title: The Faith to Ask and Then to Act
talks.synopsis: President Eyring teaches that we can receive revelation as we exercise faith and are willing to act.

talks.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
talks.title: Daily Restoration
talks.synopsis: Elder Uchtdorf teaches that we all drift spiritually at times but that we can get back on course by daily following the spiritual landmarks God has provided.

talks.author: Camille N. Johnson
talks.title: Invite Christ to Author Your Story
talks.synopsis: Sister Johnson teaches us how we can let the Savior be the author and finisher of our personal narrative by having more faith and letting God prevail in our lives.

talks.author: Dale G. Renlund
talks.title: The Peace of Christ Abolishes Enmity
talks.synopsis: Elder Renlund teaches that by putting the love of God and our discipleship of Jesus Christ first, we can overcome our differences and find peace.

talks.author: Vaiangina Sikahema
talks.title: A House of Sequential Order
talks.synopsis: Elder Sikahema teaches the blessings that can come when we live the gospel and do things in proper order.

talks.author: Quentin L. Cook
talks.title: Personal Peace in Challenging Times
talks.synopsis: Elder Cook shares five of Jesus Christ’s teachings that can help us lessen contention and find peace in today’s challenging times.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: The Temple and Your Spiritual Foundation
talks.synopsis: President Nelson refers to work on the Salt Lake Temple foundation to teach how temple ordinances and covenants strengthen our spiritual foundation.

talks.author: Gerrit W. Gong
talks.title: Trust Again
talks.synopsis: Elder Gong teaches that trust is an act of faith and that as we trust in God and each other, we receive heaven’s blessings.

talks.author: L. Todd Budge
talks.title: Giving Holiness to the Lord
talks.synopsis: Bishop Budge reports on the Church’s recent humanitarian efforts and teaches that our sacrifices in these and other efforts are consecrated gifts to the Lord.

talks.author: Anthony D. Perkins
talks.title: Remember Thy Suffering Saints, O Our God
talks.synopsis: Elder Perkins shares four principles to help those who suffer find hope and joy in Jesus Christ.

talks.author: Michael A. Dunn
talks.title: One Percent Better
talks.synopsis: Elder Dunn teaches that each effort to repent, no matter how small it may seem, can bring great blessings.

talks.author: Sean Douglas
talks.title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Douglas teaches that we face adversity best by having faith in Jesus Christ and keeping His commandments.

talks.author: Carlos G. Revillo Jr.
talks.title: Miracles of the Gospel of Jesus Christ
talks.synopsis: Elder Revillo teaches that obeying the principles and ordinances of the gospel blesses us and helps us become converted.

talks.author: Alvin F. Meredith III
talks.title: Look down the Road
talks.synopsis: Elder Meredith uses the story of Peter walking on water to teach that if we focus on Christ and beware of distractions, we can be rescued.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: The Name of the Church Is Not Negotiable
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen teaches about the importance of using the revealed name of the Church.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Make Time for the Lord
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches about the importance of making time for the Lord each day and announces new temples.

talks.author: Russell M. Nelson
talks.title: Preaching the Gospel of Peace
talks.synopsis: President Nelson teaches that we must stand in holy places and share the gospel with the world.

talks.author: M. Russell Ballard
talks.title: Missionary Service Blessed My Life Forever
talks.synopsis: President Ballard teaches about the blessings of missionary service and encourages young people to prepare and serve full-time missions.

talks.author: Reyna I. Aburto
talks.title: We Are The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
talks.synopsis: Sister Aburto teaches that the Church of Jesus Christ accomplishes its work through its members.

talks.author: David A. Bednar
talks.title: But We Heeded Them Not
talks.synopsis: Elder Bednar teaches how covenants and ordinances help us progress along the covenant path and “heed not” what others say.

talks.author: Neil L. Andersen
talks.title: Following Jesus: Being a Peacemaker
talks.synopsis: Elder Andersen explains how we can overcome contention with faith in Jesus Christ.
